loans.name: Esmerita Fatima

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Narcisa Del Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Esmerita, tiene 51 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad y uno de 12 años el cual estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por enfermedad.
Doña Esmerita es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así con su esfuerzo  salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia y mucho mas actualmente que su marido no puede trabajar, ella prepara comida para entregar,  son muchas las personas que le piden que les lleve los almuerzos a sus hogares o sitios de trabajo ya que su comida es deliciosa y cocinada de forma saludable, ella también vende en su casa víveres, artículos de limpieza y productos de plástico entre otras cosas, los mismos que entrega en su casa y a domicilio si sus clientes así lo prefieren, lleva más de 20 con este negocio con el cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres y artículos de limpieza. Lleva más de 12 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en su vida. Sus sueños es tener salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The Narcisa Del Jesús Credit Group meets every 15 days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the sultana of coffee because of its extensive fields of incomparably flavored coffee, its gastronomy, and the warmth of its people. 

Esmerita lives in this place; she is 51 years old and she is in a common-law relationship from which she has four adult children and one 12-year-old who is in school and still lives with her.  Her husband does not work because of illness. 

Esmerita is a woman who likes to work and get herself and her family ahead through her efforts, especially now that her husband cannot work.  She makes prepared food for delivery; many people place orders for lunches to be delivered to their homes or workplaces as her food is delicious and cooked healthily.  She also sells groceries, cleaning products, and plastic goods, among other things, from her home and she delivers these as well if her customers request it.  She has had her business for over 20 years and it is her means of getting her family ahead. 

This loan is to buy groceries and cleaning products.  She has been with this credit group for over 12 years and she likes it because the loans help her in life.  Her dream is for herself and her loved ones to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy groceries and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es: Don José, tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos,  vive en una  aldea  del municipio de Santa Bárbara. Don José en un tiempo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero ya tiene 19 años de cultivar maíz, frijoles y café.  Estas actividades son su fuente de ingresos para su familia. El préstamo que solicita es por 20,000 lempiras y  lo invertirá en comprar fertilizantes e insumos para asistir la finca y lograr buena cosecha. Tiene como meta seguir educando a sus hijos y tener una vida estable.
texts.en: José is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in a town in the municipality of Santa Bárbara.  José used to sell clothing for a living, but he has been growing corn, beans, and coffee for 19 years now.  These businesses are his source of income for his family.  The loan he is requesting is for 20,000 lempiras and he will invest it in fertilizers and supplies to help his farm and produce a good harvest.  His goal is to keep his children in school and have a stable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies to help his farm

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 70 años de edad, esta acompañado, tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya no dependen de él.
Manuel solo estudio primer grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivian sus padres. Manuel se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, trabajo que aprendio de sus padres, para llegar a su trabajo  viaja en caballo, trabaja en el horario de 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM los seis dias de la semana.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 2 vacas lecheras y asi obtener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa y pagar a credicampo.

Manuel sueña en comprar una yunta de bueyes, para transportar la cosecha y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 70 years old, married and has seven children who no longer depended on him for support.  Manuel has a first grade education and was not able to continue because his parents were poor. Manuel is a farmer and raises livestock, which he learned from his parents.  He travels by horse to his worksite and works from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm, six days a week.  He is asking for this loan, through CEDICAMPO, to buy two dairy cows so he can increase his income, improve his and his wife’s quality of life, and pay off this loan.

Manuel dreams of buying a team of oxen so he can transport his harvest and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not  piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

For 10 years, Josephine has operated a business selling clothes. Working seven days a week, her major challenges include seasonality and thieves. She has requested a loan of 700000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more clothes to sell. 

Josephine aspires to become an importer of clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jugos, la socia prepara diferentes jugos como fresa con leche, plátano con leche entre otros jugos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los jugos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas, platanos y papayas para preparar los jugos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower continues to work selling juices. She prepares various juices such as strawberry with milk, banana with milk and others. She has been working in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her juices. She is requesting the loan to buy apples, oranges, bananas and papayas to prepare juices. She is glad for the loan and promises to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, bananas and papayas to prepare juices.

loans.name: Anain

texts.es: Anain, tiene 22 años  de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres  en el municipio de Intibucá.  El ha trabajado junto a su familia y también se dedico a estudiar.  Ahora tiene sus propios cultivos de papas y hortalizas como brócoli, coliflor, tomate etc. Esta producción es vendida en la misma zona y con los ingresos ayuda a sus padres. El préstamo es por 15,000 lempiras  y lo invertirá en fertilizar y dar mantenimiento a una parcela de papa sembrada, lo que le ayudara a obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Anain is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the municipality of Intibucá. He has worked with his family and he is also studying. He now has his own crops of potato and vegetables such as broccoli, cauliflower, tomato, etc. This product is sold in the area and he uses the income to help his parents. The loan is for 15,000 lempiras, which he will invest in fertilizing and caring for a plot of potatoes that will help him earn a better income.

loans.use: to fertilize and care for a plot of potatoes.

loans.name: Donald José

texts.es:
El joven Donald José habita en el municipio de santa Rosa del peñón departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio y brindan su servicio a la población.

Donald José es un joven de 24 años de edad soltero de profesión y oficio maestro de educación primaria, son de sus sueños llegar a obtener su propia vivienda, ya que donde vive es de su familia. 

Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le brinde un crédito, para la compra de: un solar, esto le ayudaría mucho en un futuro lograr a construir su propia viviendita. 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho en su vida. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan en el desarrollo de su vida.
texts.en:
This young man, Donald José, lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón in the department of León, a city where the inhabitants work in various areas of commerce and offer services to the people.

Donald José is a young man of 24. He is single. His profession and work is teacher in primary education. One of his dreams is to be able to have his own house, since the place where he lives belongs to his family.

It is his great need that Ceprodel and Kiva offer him a loan so that he can purchase a solar electrical system. This will help him a lot in the future to manage to construct his own little home.

He feels happy with this type of work, because it has helped him a lot in his life.

He is grateful for the support that Ceprodel and Kiva have offered him, and he hopes in God to continue receiving this privilege, the little loans that help him in the development of his life.

loans.use: to buy a solar electrical system

loans.name: Russie

texts.en:
Russie is 25 years old. She is single and sells foodstuffs. She has been in the business for the past two years. 

With the loan, Russie would like to add more items to sell, such as beans, sugar, and salt. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parent). 

Margaret has a business of selling sugar cane and she has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bundles of sugar cane. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. 

Margaret works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a delivery van and also to buy a plot of land to start growing sugar cane. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of sugar cane.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es: Yeni, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene  1 hijo, vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara.  Yeni tiene aproximadamente 18 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos alimenticios en una pulpería, como se manteca, harina, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, pan, carnes, refrescos, productos de limpieza etc. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio.  El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 17,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar productos como manteca, harina de trigo y de maíz, azúcar, carnes etc. Para surtir y vender. Con las ganancias piensa  comprar 3 freezer para el negocio.
texts.en: Yeni, 33, has one son and lives in the municipality of  Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Yeni has 18 years of experience selling groceries in her store, like butter, wheat flour, corn flour, sugar, rice, beans, bread, meat, refreshments, cleaning products, etc. She has always worked in commerce. This is her third loan cycle and she is requesting 17,000 lempiras in order to buy products such as butter, wheat flour, corn flour, sugar, meats, etc. With the loan, she also plans to buy 3 freezers for her business.

loans.use: buy products, like butter, wheat flour and corn flour, sugar, meat, etc., to stock up on and sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos, tiene 58 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Santa Barbara. Hace 10 años se dedica al cultivo y producción de café, anteriormente se dedicaba a la producción de maíz y frijoles  solamente. Ha decidido solicitar un cuarto préstamo que es por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes e insumos y darle mantenimiento a su finca de café y  asegurar una buena cosecha. Tiene como meta terminar su casa y tener una vida esta económicamente.
texts.en:
Santos, is 58 years old and lives with his wife. He has 3 children and lives in the Santa Barbara municipality. 

He has been working as a coffee farmer for the past ten years.
 
Before that he only grew corn and beans. 

He has decided to request a loan for 25,000 HNL [$1325] to buy fertilizer and supplies and maintain his coffee plantation and ensure a good harvest. 

He has a goal to finish his house and have an economically better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies and maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена Фируза. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Ее сыну 20 лет, дочери 16 лет. Она учится в средней школе и примерная ученица.  6 лет назад, когда ее дети повзрослели у Фирузы осталось много свободного времени. Она умная женщина и не привыкла тратить время зря. Фируза решила взять в аренду не большое помещение и открыть малый бизнес. Она занимается продаже посуды, кружек, ведер, веревок и многих других хозяйственных товаров. За столь время Фируза освоила свою деятельность и хочет расширять не большой бизнес. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. На заемные средства Фируза закупит все необходимые товары на продажу.
texts.en:
Featured in this photograph is Firuza. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children. Her son is 20 and her daughter is 16. She is currently working towards her secondary school diploma and is a model student. 

6 years ago, when her children left the nest, Firuza found herself with a lot of free time. She is a smart woman, and wasn't in the habit of wasting her time. So Firuza decided to rent out a modest space and open a small business. She sells dishes, mugs, buckets, cord and other household goods. 

With some time, Firuza has mastered her business, and wants to expand her little store. For this reason she has applied for a loan. With the borrowed funds, Firuza will buy all the stock needed for sale.

loans.use: to purchase housewares to sell.

loans.name: Aliyma

texts.ru: Алийме 64 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. Все дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Младший сын и супруг помогают по бизнесу. У Алиймы- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1974 году, благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Алиймы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 дойные коровы, 10 телят, 10 овец и 2 лошади. Алийма реализует молоко и молочную продукцию. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алийма обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для закупки коров, часть средств она потратит на покупку овец. Алийма намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Алийма планирует вложить в расширение сараев для содержания скота и покупку грузового автомобиля для выезда на джайлоо.
texts.en:
Aliyma is 64 years old, married, and the mother of three adult children who are now all independent.  Her youngest son and her husband help her run the farming business.  Aliyma has a secondary education and she is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, activities which constitute the main source of income for her  family.  She started in 1974, and thanks to her persistence and hard work, she now owns two dairy cows, 10 calves, 10 sheep and two horses.

Aliyma sells milk and milk products.  She makes a total income of about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some cows and, to a lesser extent, some sheep.  Aliyma wants to increase her cattle headcount, which will surely bring more capital for her family.  Aliyma is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into increasing the size of her cattle sheds.  She would also like to buy a truck to go to out to the "jayloo", or summer highland pastures.

loans.use: to buy cows and a few sheep.

loans.name: Melba Liliana

texts.es: Melba, tiene 27 años  de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes, junto a su abuela y sus hijos.  Ella trabajo un tiempo de una maquila y hace dos años estableció su propio negocio de venta de juguetes de todo tipo para niños. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar un fardo de juguetes para surtir su negocio y aumentar las ventas. Su plan es hacerle mejoras  al local del negocio.
texts.en: Melba, 27, is a single mother. She has 2 children and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes, with her grandmother and children. For a time she worked in an assembly plant, but two years ago she established her own business selling all kinds of toys for children. She runs the business from her home. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy a bundle of toys to stock up her business and increase sales. Her plan is to make improvements to the area in which she runs her business.

loans.use: buy a bundle of toys to stock up her business.

loans.name: Lourdes Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Lourdes, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre  con su esposo con quien tiene 2 hijos y reside en Trinidad, municipio de Santa Bárbara. Se dedica a la venta de licuados de leche y frutas y repostería (pan y pasteles), refrescos, dulces etc.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años y lo tiene es un local donde alquila.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en un negocio de comidas.  El préstamo  es su segundo ciclo y es por 25,000 lempiras, el cual lo  invertirá en la compra de productos  para la venta de repostería y licuados (leche, azúcar, frutas, cereales etc.)helados, refrescos, dulces y otros. Este mismo le ayudara a surtir más el negocio y mejorar las ventas. Tiene como meta poner otro negocio más céntrico a su comunidad y que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Lourdes, is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their 2 children in Trinidad in the Santa Bárbara municipality. 

She sells milk and fruit smoothies,pastries (bread and cakes), sodas, candy etc. 

She has had this business for the past 3 years and she rents the locale. Before this she worked at a food business. 

The loan, her fifth, is for 25,000 HNL [$1,325] which she will invest in buying products to sell pastries, smoothies (milk, sugar, fruit, cereals, etc.) ice cream, sodas, sweets, etc. 

This will help her to grow her business and improve her sales. 

She has as a goal to open another business that is more centrally located to her community and to have her family live better.

loans.use: to buy products to sell pastries, smoothies (milk, sugar, fruit, cereals etc) ice cream, sodas, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Juana Azucena

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Azucena, es madre de dos lindo hijos y  labora como docente en un colegio rural desde hace doce años,  sale de su casa de habitación 6:00 inicia sus labores 7:00 am  finalizando  a las 1:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,   Por la tarde  dedica dos hora para la planificación de la clase del día siguiente,  ella  realiza esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.   

Doña Juana Azucena  solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizo para compra de una puerta de hierro para su vivienda y así de darle más seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana Azucena has two beautiful children.  She has worked as a teacher at a rural school for 12 years.  She leaves her house at 6:00 a.m. and starts her work at 7:00 a.m.  She finishes at 1:00 p.m.  She has the same schedule Mondays through Fridays.  In the afternoon she spends two hours planning for the next day’s class.  She does this work to help her husband with the household expenses.

Juana Azucena requested a loan from Ceprodel to buy an iron door for her house.  This way she will make her house more secure.

loans.use: to buy an iron door for her house.

loans.name: Erasmo José

texts.es:
El Joven Erasmo José, es propietario de un negocio en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de León desde hace diez años, inicia a ofertar sus productos a su clientela desde las  6:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm el realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar. 

El Joven solicito este  crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de sardina, atún,  dulce y productos varios, para ofrecer a sus clientes ya que se aproxima la temporada de semana santa.

El sueño de Erasmo es mantener su negocio bien establecido, y  así llegar a tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Erasmo José has had a business in one of the markets in the city of León for ten years.  He starts selling his products to his customers at 6:00 a.m., and he finishes at 5:00 p.m.  He does this work in order to support his household.

He requested this loan from Ceprodel in order to buy sardines, tuna, sweets, and various products to offer his customers because the Holy Week season is approaching.

Erasmo’s dream is to keep his business well-established.  This way he will come to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy sardines, tuna, sweets, and various products.

loans.name: Sorayda Hortencia

texts.es:
Doña Sorayda Hortencia  es madre de una hija de ocho años de edad  y se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace 16 años, ella inicia a preparar la comida de 10 am a 3 pm  y posteriormente la comercializa finalizando a las 9 pm de lunes a domingo en este mismo horario, este trabajo lo realiza para ayudar a su esposo a los gastos del hogar.   

Doña Hortencia se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la compra de  zinc, perline y mano de obra, para la reparación del techo de su vivienda ya se aproxima el invierno.
texts.en:
Sorayda Hortencia has an eight year old daughter.  Sorayda Hortencia has been selling food for 16 years.  She starts preparing the food from 10 a.m. until 3 p.m.  She later sells the food, and she finishes at 9 p.m.  It is the same schedule Mondays through Sundays.  She does this work in order to help her husband with the household expenses.

Hortencia came to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy metal sheeting and beams and to pay for the labor to repair the roof of her house.  She wants to do this because winter is coming.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Las Violetas Y El Girasol Group

texts.es: “LAS VIOLETAS Y EL GIRASOL” está conformada por socios entusiastas que trabajan día a día para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Sabina tiene 57 años de edad es casada con 06 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de frutas y confitería hace muchos años. Su mayor deseo es adquirir un stand donde puede expender sus productos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas y confitería. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Sabina es primera del lado derecho viste polo negro
texts.en: "The Violets and Sunflower" group comprises enthusiastic members who work day-to-day at improving the quality of lives of their families. Sabina, 57, is married and has 6 independent children. She's been selling fruit and sweets, by foot, for many years. Her desire is to acquire a stand where she can sell her products. She is requesting a loan to invest in more fruit and sweets. The group wants to thank the KIVA investors for their support. Sabina is the first on the right, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: buy more fruit and sweets.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 31 years old. She is a mother of five children and they all go to school. She sells animals such as goats, chickens and cows. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows and goats for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more goats, chickens and cows for resale.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a single mother of four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother's child). She has a business of a pub and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, jerry cans of local gin, chairs, and a radio. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in the pub seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and law enforcement officers. She aspires to move her business to a larger location. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, jerry cans of local gin, chairs, and a radio.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María,  tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene  2 hijos  y vive en una comunidad  del municipio de Santa Barbará. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y golosinas, refrescos, agua etc.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años  en su casa. Antes de este negocio  se dedicaba a la venta de ropa.  Solicita un tercer ciclo de préstamo que  es por 13,000 lempiras para la  compra de productos como harina, carnes, refrescos, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, condimentos, etc. para la elaboración y venta de comidas. Su plan es poder  mejorar el  local  del negocio para brindar mejor servicio y mantenerlo surtido.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old, married, has two children and lives in a community in the Santa Barbará municipality. 

She sells food, candy, soda, water, etc. 

She has had this business for the past 5 years out of her house. 

Before she had the business she sold clothes. 

This is her third loan and is requesting 13,000 HNL [$700]  to buy products such as flour, meat, soda, sugar, beans, butter, spices etc. for preparing and selling food. 

Her plan is to improve the locale in order to provide a better service and to maintain an inventory.

loans.use: to buy products such as flour, meat, soda, sugar, beans, butter, spices etc. for preparing and selling food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton and lace materials for resale.

loans.name: Henry Gabriel

texts.es:
El señor Henry Gabriel, es soltero y  desempeña sus labores como decente en una universidad   de la ciudad de Chinandega  desde hace dieciocho  años, inicia sus labores a las 7:00 am y finaliza a las 3:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,  los días sábado y domingo tres hora cada día.  

El crédito que solicito a Ceprodel lo utilizó para la Compra de cemento, arena y cerámica  para acondicionar su cuarto y así tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Henry Gabriel is single.  He has been working as a teacher at a university in the city of Chinandega for 18 years.  He starts his work at 7:00 a.m., and he finishes at 3:00 p.m.  It is the same schedule Monday through Friday.  On Saturdays and Sundays he works three hours each day.

He will use the loan that he requested from Ceprodel to buy cement, sand, and ceramic tile in order to fix up his room.  This way he will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and ceramic tile.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por  tres socias trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Lissete de 44 años de edad, acompañada, se dedica a la venta de cítricos en el mercado de Masaya, en este negocio no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie, ella se encarga de comprar los cítricos y luego comercializarlos en el mercado de  la localidad, por lo que el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como el limón y naranja principalmente. Otras de las socias son las señoras Yamilett de 37 años comerciante de perecederos en el mercado de la localidad y Justina de 53 años comerciante de frutas y verduras, ellas son un ejemplo de superación.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three working members, coordinated by Lissete. She is 44 years old, in a relationship, and she makes a living selling citrus fruits in the Masaya market. She does not have the help of anyone else in her business; she deals with buying the citrus fruits and then selling them in the local market, which is why she needs the loan to buy products, mainly lemons and oranges. 

The other members are Yamilett, who is 37 years old and sells perishable goods in the local market; and Justina who is 53 years old and sells fruits and vegetables. They are an example of self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy lemon and orange harvests.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: Meet Salina. She is a mother of eight children who has been farming in Eldoret for the last 10 years. She sells milk and maize to take care of her family. She enjoys dairy farming a lot and names each animal she gets.  Recently, Salina formed a group composed of fellow women. They joined Juhudi Kilimo as a group where they got trained on modern farming practices (mainly poultry). Salina had always kept chickens for subsistence purposes, but now she is educated on how she can turn it into a big business.  Salina is seeking a loan to construct a poultry unit where she can keep broilers and layers. By embracing modern commercial techniques, she will be able to generate enough income to comfortably repay the loan and take better care of her eight children. She will also be able to act as a model farmer for other women in her area who keep chickens for subsistence.

loans.use: to construct a poultry house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby lotions, body creams, soaps, and baby food for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local plantain seed stock and cover the costs for their planting, maintenance, and harvest

loans.name: Benito Javier

texts.es:
El Joven Benito Javier, se dedica a la venta de CD y  DVD desde hace ocho  años, para llevar el sustento a su familia,  inicia a exhibir sus productos a su clientela a las 8 am y finaliza 5 pm de lunes a  sábado en este mismo horario.
 
El Joven solicito este  crédito a Ceprodel para incrementar  su inventario con  controles, juego play, DVD y cargadores para celulares.
 
Benito Javier sueña con la preparación de sus cuatro hijos que están a su cargo.
texts.en:
Young Benito Javier has had a business selling CDs and DVDs for 8 years, so that he could help support his family.  He starts to display his products to his customers at 8am, and he finishes at 5pm, Monday through Saturday, on the same schedule.

This youth is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to increase his inventory with video games, game controllers, DVDs and cellular chargers.  

Benito Javier dreams of educating his 4 dependent children.

loans.use: to buy controllers, video games, DVDs and cell phone chargers

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Matilde Argentina, es madre de ocho hijos y se dedica al comercio desde hace 9 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de marisco anteriormente vendía frutas y verduras,  ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela de  6 am  a  2 pm y  realiza esta labor para la manutención de sus dos pequeños hijos que están en edad escolar.   

Doña Matilde  solicito  a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo  para  incrementar su inventario  con variedad de pescados, punches y conchas para lograr mayor venta y  así tener un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a sus lindo hijitos.
texts.en:
Matilde Argentina is a mother of eight children and has been selling different products for 9 years. Her current business is selling seafood; previously she sold fruit and vegetables. She works from 6am until 2pm to help support her two young children who are of school age.

Matilde is requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to increase her inventory with a variety of fish, crabs and oysters so that she can achieve higher sales. These higher sales will provide better living conditions for her and her beautiful children.

loans.use: to buy fish, crab and oysters.

loans.name: Ramon Ernesto

texts.es: Ramón de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el posee un molino desde hace 8 años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas ya que el es una persona muy amable y responsable, Don Ramón solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Ramón is 45 years old, and he lives in his own house with his family. He has owned a grinder for 8 years and he has many customers, mainly women who prepare tortillas. They come to grind corn to prepare the tortillas because he is a very friendly and responsible person.

Ramón is requesting for a loan to be able to buy blades, discs, and all of the necessary tools to have a good grinder. In this way he will continue with his work to provide his family with their daily sustenance without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, and all of the necessary tools for his grinder

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Shaminah

texts.en: Shaminah is married with two children, neither of whom goes to school because they are too young. She has a business of selling tomatoes and has been in this business for four months.   She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability. She is aspiring of changing her tomato business to a retail shop and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en: Theresie is 41 years old. She is married with seven children. She has been selling sugar and beans for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings, and for the future of the business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 23 years old. She is married but does not yet have a child. With the loan she would like to buy more cooking oil, maize flour and peanuts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, maize flour and peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth ofrece  artículos varios, usando catálogos que sus proveedores le suministran para vender. Desde hace 10 años, aprendió de  varias de sus amigas dedicadas a este negocio, y cuando estuvo lista, decidió ser independiente e hizo su primer pedido directamente a los proveedores  y así fue como empezó a construir su propio mercado. Hoy su tarea comercial no cesa y ofrece de lunes a domingos su mercancía entre un mercado doméstico conformado por sus amigas, vecinos, empleados, que poco a poco lo refieren y con ellos su negocio se ha fortalecido. En la actualidad su meta es abrir su propio local mas adelante y lograr finalmente generar cada vez más bienestar, para sus hijos que hoy se encuentran en las edades de 1 y 12 años. Actualmente está acudiendo a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de tocador y para el hogar. Con su credikiva tendrá un capital fijo para poder cumplir con los requerimientos de su clientela, que se mueven entre sus necesidades, deseos e intereses para comprar sus productos.
texts.en:
Yaneth sells a variety of items with catalogs from her suppliers.  Ten years ago she learned this trade from some friends who were in this business, and when she was ready she decided to start work independently.  She made her first order directly to the suppliers, and this is how she started to build her own business.  

Today her work does not cease; she offers her merchandise for sale daily in her domestic market, made up of friends, neighbors, and employees.  Over time, they refer others to her business, and so her business has become stronger over time.  At this time, her goal is to open her own store in the future, so that she can finally provide her children with greater well-being.  Her children are currently 1 and 12 years old.  

Yaneth is requesting a Kiva loan now, the first financing she has done through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to buy toiletries and items for the home.  With this Kiva loan, she will have some fixed capital that she can use to meet the needs of her customers, who buy her products based on their needs, desires and interests.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and household products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, fans, T. V., a radio set and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар 41 год. Она начинающий предприниматель из района Спитамен. Санобар по характеру целеустремленная и коммуникабельная женщина. Она планирует открыть свой торговый бизнес в области продажи хозяйственных товаров и верит, что он будет успешным. Семья будет ей опорой и поддержкой. Санобар замужем и у нее трое детей, двое девочек и один мальчик. Она начинает свой бизнес ради улучшения условий их проживания. Санобар уже приобрела помещение под магазин и обустроила его. Единственное ей осталось закупить товар. Для этой цели она просит кредит. Она очень нуждается в заемных средствах, так как ее собственного начального капитала не хватает. Поддержите Санобар в открытии ее собственного дела.
texts.en: Sanobar is 41 years old.  She is an aspiring entrepreneur from the Spitamen region.  By nature, she is determined and sociable.  She plans to start her own business selling home products, and she believes in the success of her enterprise.  Her family will offer help and support.  Sanobar is married and the mother of three children (two girls and a boy).  She is starting this business for the sake of improving her family's living conditions.  She has already acquired and furnished some commercial space to be used as a shop.  The only thing that she still needs to do is to buy her merchandise, and this is the reason why she is requesting a loan.  She really needs this credit because her own start-up capital is not enough.  Would you please support Sanobar and help her to open her own business?

loans.use: to start her own business selling home products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also to educate her children up to university. She works in the shop seven days out of every week. She resides in a family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hardworking man who goes out every day to sell shoes to both men and women who live near his home.  

Paul lives in Accra Dansoman. He is 38 years old, married, and has children. He is asking for this loan to buy both men's and women's shoes, and sell them to customers. In this way he can manage to increase orders for the products he offers. Paul hopes to keep receiving support from Kiva to be able to achieve one of his dreams, which is to make his home better for merchandise sales. He longs to achieve financial stability, which will assure a prosperous future for his business and his family.

loans.use: to buy and sell shoes to both men and women who live near his home.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel de 34 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad comercial, desde febrero del año 2009.   Su esposa y él, al comprar artículos a comerciantes vinculados a empresas multinacionales, que se los ofrecían mediante guías especializadas y percibieron que mediante esta misma actividad podían generar ingresos. Decididos se incorporaron a estas cadenas comerciales de multinivel y posteriormente fueron agregando mas artículos, pues su clientela le encargaba variedad de jeans, cosméticos, calzado, ropa de dormitorio etc.   Poco a poco reunieron capital y debieron comprar 2 vitrinas para exhibirlos y mantener ordenado su negocio. Hoy su negocio se muestra ordenado y Abel y su esposa trabajan en é yes fuente principal de ingresos. Sus clientes están ubicados en diversos barrios de la ciudad y en su estantería encuentran perfumes, cosméticos productos de belleza, fantasía, que finalmente llega a las manos de su clientela de manera directa. Sus vecinos son sus principales compradores y también muchas personas que se encuentran empleadas y a las que Abel y su esposa, les ofrecen crédito para que de forma fácil y ajustada a su presupuesto, puedan obtener los artículos que desean. En la actualidad Abel está acudiendo a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía variada, dirigida a mujeres especialmente, pues se acerca el día de la madre y Abel y su esposa quieren tener sus inventarios bien dotados de lo que los clientes requieran en esta temporada, para vender y ganar un poco mas de dinero aprovechando la época. Su meta de crecimiento  empresarial no se detiene, porque tiene como meta familiar, lograr viajar a Estados Unidos de América, para compartir con su familia. Su mayor desafío es no tener los recursos suficientes para lograr cada vez un mayor bienestar .
texts.en:
Abel is 34 years old. He has been working as a merchant since February of 2009. He and his wife found out they could buy items from companies connected to multinational firms that sell things through special catalogs. They believed that they could earn money with this business. Their minds made up, they joined with these multi-level commercial chains and then began adding more items. Their customers requested a variety of jeans, cosmetics, footwear, nightwear, etc. Little by little, they pulled together some capital and had to buy 2 vitrines in order to show their products and keep their business tidy. Now their business looks organized and Abel and his wife work in their business and it is their main source of income. 

Their customers are located in many neighborhoods on the city, and on their shelves they find perfumes, cosmetics, beauty products, and costume jewelry. These arrive directly in the hands of their customers. Their neighbors are their main buyers and also many people who are employed. Abel and his wife offer easy credit that is adjusted to people’s budgets so they can get the items they want. 

Abel is currently requesting a Kiva loan, his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will buy a variety of merchandise directed especially toward women. Mother’s Day is coming up and Abel and his wife want to have their inventory well stocked with what customers need at this time of year so they can sell and earn a little more money, taking advantage of the season. His goal to grow the business can’t be stopped because they have as a family goal to travel to the United States and share that with their family. His main challenge is not having sufficient income to continually improve their wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, colognes, footwear, and household items.

loans.name: Corrette

texts.en: Corrette is 63 years old. She is a widow and has been in business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush lives in Hartashen village in the Syunik region.

She lives there with her big family of 5: her husband, parents-in-law and two grandchildren. Vardanush learned how to run the farm when she was a little girl. Now, she is married and helps her husband to run a successful farm. They keep 15 cows and 10 calves, and they sell the gathered milk and meat in local markets. Vardanush also has some limited cultivation of wheat. 

The requested loan of USD 3000 will greatly assist Vardanush to purchase forage for the livestock. The loan will be a big support for Vardanush's farm, so she waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestcok

loans.name: Hayastan

texts.en:
Hayastan lives in Mayisyan village with her husband and two children. They live in Gyumri City, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities in Armenia that was affected by a devastating and destructive earthquake in 1987. The people of Gyumri have been largely affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive. Hayastan and her family are involved in farming. They keep livestock (cows, pigs, chickens and calves) as well as cultivate wheat and potato. Hayastan also grows apple and pear trees.

Hayastan has requested this loan of USD 3000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation. The loan is important for Hayastan to expand her farm and gather more income for her family's living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 39 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su familia en casa propia. Wilfredo está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía,  ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 39 years old and has been farming for several years. He plants beans and corn and then sells whatever he harvests so that he can cover his household expenses. Wilfredo is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man who lives in his own home along with his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for his crops such as fertilizers, compost, seeds, and other items so that he can improve his land, which is shown in the photograph. Wilfredo is not able to cover all of his expenses with what he earns, so having more income will provide better financial stability for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Teresa Victoria

texts.es:
Tersa Victoria tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cebiche, papa rellena y refrescos, su esposo se desempeña como jornalero agrícola, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de utensilios descartables para su negocio y de esta manera distribuir sus preparos de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Teresa Victoria is 51 years old and lives with her husband and children in the District of Lagunas, a community that is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Teresa sells “ceviche” (marinated seafood), stuffed potatoes, and soft drinks. Her husband works as a farm laborer. She is requesting a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy disposable utensils for her business. This will allow her to do a better job of selling her prepared foods.

loans.use: to buy disposable utensils for her business.

loans.name: Lilibeth Maria

texts.es: Lilibeth de 22 años de edad, habita en un municipio del departamento del Atlántico, con su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad. Para  incrementar sus ingresos, su suegra le propuso dedicarse a la actividad comercial y entusiasmada Lilibeth accedió, invirtiendo un pequeño capital en fantasía. Poco a poco ha ido surgiendo y hoy  los principales productos de su oferta son las prendas de plata y fantasías variadas que compra de contado  en el centro de la ciudad, donde adquiere buenos precios para llevarlos a su clientela, a quienes les vende a crédito y también de contado. Lilibeth desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde distribuye los artículos entre vecinos y amigos; estos  a su vez le han suministrado referidos y por como ella está dispuesta a hacer crecer su estructura de clientes, debe superar el desafío de lograr efectivo disponible, para comprar más productos y ampliar su mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará platería y fantasías de diversas piedras y colores, para que el género femenino las luzca en su cuello, cabeza, manos y ropa y se sientan feliz por su elegancia y con deseos de volver a comprarle. Su meta más adelante es tener un local donde ofrecer su mercancía y aumentar el bienestar de su familia, trabajando en lograr permanentemente fuentes de financiación que la apalanquen como lo hace KIVA.
texts.en:
Lilibeth, 22, lives in a municipality inside the Atlantico district with her husband and small one year old daughter. To increase her income, her mother-in-law proposed taking up a commercial endeavor and Lilibeth excitingly accepted by investing some capital in costume jewelry. Little by little her business has grown and today her main products that she offers are a variety of silver and costume jewelry that she buys in the city center. There she finds the items at good prices that she can sell to her customers either on credit or in cash. 

Lilibeth works from 8am to 6pm distributing the jewelry pieces amongst neighbors and friends. They in turn provide more references and as she is ready to grow her customer base, she must overcome the challenge of having enough cash available to buy more products and expand her market. For this reason she is asking for a credikiva, the first loan provided by la Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will buy silver items and costume jewelry of various stones and colors so that women can wear them on their neck, head, hands and clothes and feel happy due to their elegance. Looking good will also make them want to come back and buy more.

Her goal in the future is to have her own store where she can offer her products and increase the wellbeing of her family by working on achieving permanent sources of funding to leverage such as KIVA’s.

loans.use: to buy silver and costume jewelry of various stones and colors.

loans.name: Umucyo Cb Group

texts.en: Racheri is 37 years old. She is the group leader of Umucyo in Kinyarwanda, which means Light in English. She is married with three children aged between three and nineteen. None of the children are going to school.  The group leader and the group members are working hard to achieve results that helps them improve themselves and the society in which they are living. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and make local juice. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. Racheli has raised her hand as symbol of identification from the other group members.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 38 years old. She is married with three children. She has sold vegetables and fruits for the past twenty years. With the loan, she would like to buy more onions, tomatoes and carrots for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and save for a better future for the business.

loans.use: To buy more onions, tomatoes and carrots for sale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
This is Asha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of potatoes, vegetables and tomatoes for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, vegetables and tomatoes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase groundnuts, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mariamik

texts.en:
Mariamik is from Mets Sepasar village. Together with her husband and two grown up children, she has been involved in the farming business.

Specifically, Mariamik and her family keep livestock (cows, sheep, pigs and piglets) and cultivate wheat. Agribusiness is the only source of the family's income and it is vital for covering their daily costs.

Mariamik requested this loan of USD 3000 to be able to purchase two cows and enlarge her livestock.

The loan is important for the whole family and they wait for the lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay  for two cows

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en: Hermine lives in Gandzaqar Village with her two children. Her husband is migrant worker seeking a job to sustain his family. To tackle financial hardships and sustain her family's living, Hermine runs a farm. She keeps four cows, chickens and a colony of bees and she cultivates corn, potatoes and grass. Hermine sells the gathered harvest locally and gets an income for her children. Due to her hard work, Hermine is able to run her farm successfully. The requested loan of USD 3,000 will greatly help Hermine to purchase pigs, calves, seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. She will wait for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, calves, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine lives in Kapan with her husband and two school age children.

Qristine's husband is a taxi driver who makes Kapan-Yerevan transits using his own car.

Qristine herself runs a farm. She keeps livestock (cows, calves, pigs and piglets) and sells the gathered milk and meat in the local open market. The requested amount of USD 3000 is important for Qristine to enlarge her livestock with three more cows and expand her cattle breeding.

The loan will greatly assist her and Qristine hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Sarigyugh village. She is a teacher working at local village school. Besides work, Alvard also is a farmer.

She keeps a cow, sheep and 30 chickens. Alvard also cultivates different types of vegetables (potato, corn, wheat) and grows a wide variety of fruit trees (plum, nut, apple and pear).

Alvard is very hardworking woman who runs her farm with great love and care. She has requested this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase seeds, fertilizer, a calf and cover rental costs of a tractor. The loan will be a big support for Alvard's farm and she hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, a calf and cover rental costs of a tractor

loans.name: Esat

texts.en:
Esat, seen in the picture grazing his herd of sheep, wants to add some baby sheep to the existing herd of 70 sheep, 40 baby sheep, 3 milk cows, 1 mule and 1 horse. In addition to all of the above animals, he plants and harvests wheat, corn and fodder. He sells the raw milk to nearby dairy farms and as for the grains; he sells them to wholesale buyers. The soil in the village is not very supportive of plants. Hence, the villagers plant a bit of seasonal veggies, corn and wheat. They also have plum orchards.

Esat, a 56-year-old villager from a steep village in the southern rural area of Albania, is a father of two. His daughter was born a paraplegic and she requires her parent’s constant attention.  The fact that they reside in the village and they have no accommodations for the daughter makes it more difficult for them to look after her.

loans.use: to buy more baby sheep

loans.name: Kijapan Group

texts.en: Aidah is a third time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance ltd. Her previous loan was UGX 500,000 for the purpose of purchasing a sewing machine. She runs a shop in the city outskirts, and she has borrowed a loan of UGX 500,000 to add more second hand clothing to her business. She is married with three children of whom one goes to school. However, she runs a transport business of bodaboda, and she has one motorcycle maxi making money for her which has helped her to increase her savings and income. Her plan is to see her retail shop grow into a wholesale shop. She wishes to borrow more to invest in her retail shop. She is so grateful to Ugafode Microfinance for the great assistance given to her as a low income earner.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and fabric and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials and renovate his workplace .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosa continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva bue tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende diferentes productos como leche, golosinas, arroz entre otros, la socia continua trabajando durante el día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Rosita de Los Angeles” which is located in the District of San Sebastián in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. She continues to manage a grocery business. Rosa has been in this line of work for a long time and it has given her both financial and personal satisfaction. She sells different products such as milk, snack foods, rice, and other items. Rosa continues to work during the day. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, oil, and other products. She appreciates the loan that has been given to her and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Munay Soncco Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Munay Soncco” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de papas, comida, ropa, comestibles, frutas, verduras, cosméticos y otros brindan servicios de internet. 

Yanet nació en la provincia del Cusco, es conviviente y tiene una hijita, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche , aceite y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas mas.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
This group of friends and neighbors form the Munay Soncco communal bank in Cusco. This communal bank is comprised of people who are always looking for opportunities to move forward, and who provide their children with a better future with their daily efforts. The jobs of the members include selling potatoes, food, clothes, groceries, fruit, vegetables, cosmetics, and providing internet service.

Yanet was born in the province of Cusco. She has a partner and a daughter. She has a small business in selling basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other items.

In general, the members are grateful for this opportunity and they promise to make the various payments on time.

Cusco is in the district and province of Cusco, in the Cusco department, which is in the heart of the old Incan city. It is known for being a touristic area due to its archaeological centers, historic centers, and its history, and also for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce, its traditional Into Raymi festival, and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sacks of sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a hard-working Reverend living in Hoima Uganda and works seven days a week. He is forty nine years old. He is married with six children and five attend school. He earns extra income from agriculture. A higher calling inspired him to minister to God's people. He faces challenges of seasonal changes and inadequate capital to sustain his business. His dream is to start up an orphanage home to look after the less privileged.

Justus is acquiring a loan to buy building materials such as cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and sand.

loans.name: Diana Katherine

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Narcisa Del Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Diana y su marido tienen un negocio en el centro de la ciudad, allí ellos venden útiles escolares, artículos de bazar, computadores, impresoras, accesorios y demás repuestos de computadoras, entre otras cosas, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, este negocio lo tienen por más de 13 años con el cual ellos salen delante de una forma honesta y a base de trabajo.  En esta temporada todo lo quieren invertir en útiles escolares ya que se viene la época de entrada a clases y es cuando mejores ventas tienen de estos productos y mejores ganancias les dejan. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar útiles escolares. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que los arriendos se le llevan buena parte de las ganancias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Narcisa del Jesús” meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa, which is known by its nickname "The Sultana of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crop that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food and the warmth of its people.

Sra. Diana lives in this place. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children (ages 7 and 2). Her older child is in school and her husband is a merchant.

Doña Diana and her husband have a business in the central part of the city where they sell school supplies, bazaar merchandise, computers, printers, accessories, computer parts, and other items. They work every day from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Diana and her husband have managed this business for more than 13 years and they have been able to get ahead through honest work. During this season, they want to invest entirely in school supplies since classes are about to start. This is when they see improved sales from these products and better earnings.

Diana’s loan will be used to buy school supplies. She has been with the Communal Bank for eight years and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped to finance her business. Her dreams include having a shop of her own since a large portion of her profit goes toward paying rent.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a twenty-five-year-old married female with one child going to school, living in Kasese, Uganda. She deals in the retail business working twelve hours a day on a busy street plus she has rentals as additional income. Elizabeth started the business to look after her child and needs a loan to buy bread to sell. Elizabeth hopes to expand her business into new markets although she faces the challenge of high license fees.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: Adalberto tien 48 años de edad y desde hace 12 años empezó su negocio, aprovechando su experiencia como ayudante de carnicería en una empresa del municipio donde habita, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas en las edades de 6 y 8 años. Entre los productos de su oferta están la carne de res, el pollo y el pescado , lo cual vende al detalle directamente y de contado en su expendio, de lunes a sabdos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Adalberto compra a mayoristas que distribuyen los productos cárnicos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con los cuales logra precios especiales y los ofrece a su mercado de clientes, que son sus vecinos y tiendas de barrio ubicadas al rededor de su negocio.  Su meta inmediata  es aumentar sus ventas a 2 reses diarias , porque  mas adelante, tiene el propósito de remodelar su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carne de res, pollo y pescado en un mayor volumen, atendiendo a que la venta de este último producto, se incrementa con motivo de la celebración de la semana mayor, temporada en la cual planea respnder a sus clientes, para lograr su mayor desafio de fidelizarlos, con un buen servicio, un producto fresco y muy buenos precios. Lo que hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en: Adalberto is 48 years old. He started his business 12 years ago, taking advantage of his experience as an assistant at a butcher shop in a business in the town he lives. He lives with his spouse and their two daughters, aged 6 and 8. Among the products he offers are beef, chicken and fish. He sells retail and gets paid in cash in his store. He works Monday through Saturday from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Adalberto buys from wholesalers who distribute meat in the city of Barranquilla. That way, he able to offer special prices in the market to his customers, who are the residents and stores in the neighborhood near his business. He immediate goal is to increase his sales to selling 2 whole beef a day, because in the future, his goal is to remodel his house. Right now, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy beef, chicken and fish in a greater volume. He will sell this latest product. Sales will increase during Holy Week. He plans on being able to respond to his customers so he can achieve his biggest challenge, which is gaining their loyalty with good service, a fresh product and very good prices. This will make his Kiva loan very successful.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken and fish in a larger volume.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald used his previous loan to buy sugar to sell. He has been in the business of selling clothes for the past five years. He also carries out agriculture and retail trade. He has the challenges of price fluctuation but hopes to become a reknowned enterprising business man.

He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell during the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell during the Easter season

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and 26-year-old son in the Kvareli district, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. 

She gets orders and bakes cakes from home. Her husband and son work physically to generate income. 

Mariam decided to open a shop, where she will sell her cakes. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 Georgia Lari (GEL) and start a business. After opening a shop, she will have more clients and will be able to increase the income. 

Mariam is very hardworking woman, and she plans to reinvest the income in the business for further expansion.

loans.use: to open a cake shop

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is 45 years old. She lives with her daughter, Tamta, in a small village in the Kvareli district. Tamta works as a sales officer at a local financial institution and gets a small monthly income. Elene is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a vineyard and a small plot of agricultural land, where she grows nut trees. Elene is a very hardworking woman and does her best to insure a good harvest. She sells the harvested products at local supermarkets. 

Elene has decided to start a trading business and has requested a loan. The Start up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. She will use the received credit to purchase used clothes which she will then resell among her villagers. This will increase her income and Elene will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to begin selling used clothes

loans.name: Las Costureras Group

texts.en:
“Las Costureras”, which means “The Seamstresses”, is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank in Chichicastenango, Guatemala. There are nine women in the group and, as their name suggests, the majority of them are seamstresses. The ladies, who are friends and neighbors, are beginning their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They are looking forward to improving their businesses and their quality of life.

Catarina, a 22-year-old member of the Trust Bank, is the mother of a beautiful girl who is just over a year old. She is the joy of her mother’s life! Catarina sews ornaments and trims to decorate typical blouses called “huipiles” (pronounced “we-pee-les”). She sells her work by the yard. As is the case with her fellow Trust Bank members, Catarina is beginning her second loan cycle. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of fabrics and various colors of high quality thread. Her faithful and long time customers know that Catarina’s work is of very high quality and so they return to her repeatedly for new orders.

Catarina only reached the 6th grade and enjoys the monthly meetings with the Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. Besides making payments on their loans, the ladies participate in educational training sessions. A variety of topics are discussed, such as business and money management, women’s identity, leadership and self-esteem, as well as children’s and women’s health and rights. With the knowledge that the women gain, they feel more empowered and able to manage their businesses and their lives more successfully. It is the combination of the loans and the educational trainings that Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus”.

Catarina and the rest of the group are so appreciative and grateful that people from other parts of the world are interested in helping them help themselves. They look forward to a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community. Finally, they want KIVA investors to know that they send each person greetings from “The Land of Eternal Spring”....Guatemala!

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and various colors of high quality thread

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Dios es Amor”, meaning “God is Love”, is composed of eleven women from rural Quiche in northwestern Guatemala. Most of them are mothers and are responsible for 30 children. They are hardworking and have the collective goal of improving their own and their families' lives.

 Antonia is a 47-year-old member of the Trust Bank. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she only attended school for one year. Along with her siblings, she was forced to work at an early age. Because of her efforts and dedication, Antonia learned many sewing techniques nine years ago. She began a textile business and now employs eight people from her community. She supplies them with thread, yarn and fabric and they transform these raw materials into napkins, tablecloths and aprons. Her husband is also involved in the business. Antonia is able to deliver 55-60 dozen items per week! Antonia is currently requesting a new loan, which she will use to purchase additional thread and fabric. She will use the proceeds to maintain and expand her current business with the ultimate goal of finding new customers in order to generate increased income. She wants to see each family involved in her business improve their standard of living with better food and more education for the children. Four of Antonia’s six children are in school and she visualizes them attending college!

The ladies of the “Dios es Amor” Trust Bank extend their heartfelt gratitude to KIVA investors for funding their loans. They have the ambition and drive to improve their lives and the loans are a wonderful vehicle to help them help themselves. Thank you KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase additional thread and fabric.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is an associate requesting a special loan from Esperanza's Water Project, which gives associates and members from social groups in any community Esperanza serves this type of loan to help their communities. In this special loan, Maritza is representing her church in the community of Monte Plata. The church, Iglesia de Dios de Monte Plata, started this water project in order to provide purified water to the inhabitants of their community, delivering the service at a low price but with high quality and proper standards.

They want to use this loan to buy a truck to pick up and distribute the water to sellers and clients all over their community. They also want to restructure their distribution point where they sterilize gallons, fill bottles with purified water and deliver them to the neighbors that go directly to the business to buy them or sellers that distribute them. By "improve," they mean to buy 5-gallon water bottles and labels, change system pieces, paint walls and other investments.

Maritza is in change of the water project called Punto de Distribucion de Agua Monte Plata (Distribution Water Monte Plata). Approximately 35,000 people live in their neighborhood, and their plan is to distribute purified water to 2,000 families, at a cost of $0.50 US for a 5-gallon bottle of water. With this, Maritza said, they want to impact different areas: economic, health, spiritual and many others. This community, like others in the Dominican Republic, is an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo with many health problems, potable water scarcity, diseases, pollution, etc. This project plans to distribute these bottles to at least 2,000 families and businesses weekly. 

Maritza thanks God, Esperanza Internacional, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and the name of all of her church members, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a vehicle and other materials for water distribution.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
In a rural area in the highlands of northwest Guatemala, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “La Esperanza”, meaning “Hope”, is located about 20 minutes from the town of Quiche. The group consists of ten women, with an average age of 33 years and an average of 3 children per person. The Trust Bank is starting its 4th loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. It is run by a Board of Directors. Most of the women are involved in textile and handicraft production. 

Elena, a married 28-year-old woman with two children, is the current treasurer. She owns a small convenience store which enables her to generate enough income to support her small family. Education is a priority for Elena and she is pleased that her two children are attending the 4th and 6th grades. This energetic lady is requesting a loan in order to increase her inventory and intends to purchase additional quantities of items for daily consumption including rice, beans, flour, oatmeal, noodles, coffee and drinks. When asked why she likes being a part of Friendship Bridge, Elena responded that she likes the non-formal educational trainings that a Loan Officer gives each month at the meetings. Relevant topics discussed include women’s leadership, rights and identity, discrimination, self-esteem as well as nutrition, health and medicinal plants.
