The women of the “La Esperanza” Trust Bank appreciate the kindness and generosity of KIVA investors who provide capital for their loans. They face brighter and more successful tomorrows with their loans and education. We look forward to providing a follow-up report on their progress!

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of items for daily consumption, including rice, beans, flour, oatmeal, noodles, coffee and drinks

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Carmen tiene 48 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven  cultiva frutas tuna manzana palta chirimoya. Y los fines de semana presta servicios domésticos. Es de esta manera que puede apoyar económicamente a su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos. En el grupo “ADELANTE COCACHACRA” cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Carmen es la que se encuentra sentada.
texts.en: Carmen, 48, is single and has two adult children. She makes a living in agriculture. From a very young age, she has cultivated fruit, tuna, apples, avocados, and custard apple.  On the weekends, she offers domestic services. This allows her to financially support her family. She will invest the loan into buying fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops. She serves as treasurer in the Adelante Cocachara group. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loans they provide. In the photo, Carmen is the one sitting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her crop.

loans.name: Ahorrar Es Exito Group

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche hace 08 años en forma ambulatoria. De esta manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de de mesas y banca para su negocio. En el grupo “AHORRAR ES ÉXITO” cumple la función de secretaria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jacqueline es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Jacqueline is 28 years old, in a relationship, and has two dependent children.  She has sold ceviche on foot for eight years.  This allows her to help her husband with their children's education and food expenses.  She will invest in tables and a bench for her business.  She is the secretary of the Ahorrar Es Éxito Group.  The group thanks Kiva's investors for the loan they have offered.  Jacqueline is the first on the left.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 52 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 19 años, en un municipio área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Allí genera ingresos mediante una ferretería, negocio que inició desde hace 4 años, después de adquirir su experiencia cuando fue empleado de una  de ellas por más de 25 años. Aprovechando que a su esposa la liquidaron de la empresa donde trabajaba, inició su aventura de negocios familiar atendiendo su aptitud hacia el negocio.. En la ferretería sus clientes pueden encontrar bloques, pinturas, clavos, cemento, tornillos y todo tipo de accesorio para construcción. Sus principales compradores son sus vecinos, que mediante sus pedidos  guían las decisiones de compra de Jorge. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará , tornillería, puertas, y accesorios para el hogar, para tener una mejor exhibición de inventarios ajustados a la demanda y a la rotación diaria de sus productos. Su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiamiento, como la que le ha ofrecido la Fundación, través de Kiva y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión sea exitosa y ayude a aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Fifty-two-year-old Jorge lives with his partner and their two children, who are 12 and 19 years old, in a municipality of metropolitan Barranquilla.  He earns a living there through his hardware store, a business he started four years ago after gaining over 25 years of experience as an employee at another store.  Taking advantage of his wife's being laid off at the business where she worked, he started this family business putting her aptitude for business to use.  His customers at the hardware store can find cinder blocks, paint, nails, cement, screws, and all kinds of construction accessories.  His main buyers are his neighbors, who guide Jorge's buying decisions with their orders.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so he can buy nuts and bolts, doors, and home accessories.  This will give him a better spread of inventory tailored to the demand and daily turnover of his products.  His greatest challenge is finding lenders, such as Fundación through Kiva, and that is exactly what will make his investment successful and help improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nuts and bolts, doors, and home accessories

loans.name: Agleidys

texts.es: Agleidys de 25 años de edad es madre de 2 hijas de 4 y 6 años. Desde hace 3 años inició su aventura empresarial, atendiendo a su aptitud como negociante que había descubierto desde muy niña, cuando encontraron divertido jugar virtualmente y lograr tener dinero vendiendo juegos. Hoy su marco de referencia es más amplio y sueña con hacer crecer este mismo negocio, que nació como un juego de niños, para aumentar la calidad de vida de sus hijas. Su mayor desafío es tener fuentes de financiación para fortalecer su imagen en el mercado, mejorando su infraestructura locativa, y esto es justamente lo que quiere lograr mediante su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que  para adecuar el local y ofrecer comodidad a su clientela a la que quiere fidelizar..
texts.en:
Agleidys, 25, is the mother of two daughters ages 4 and 6. Three years ago, she started a business venture, taking advantage of her skills as a negotiator that she gained from a young age. She enjoyed playing games and earning money by selling games. Now, her knowledge has grown and she dreams of creating this same business, which started as a child's game. She hopes this will increase her daughters' quality of life. Her greatest challenge is having the financing to strengthen her image in the market, improving the infrastructure of her property.

This is exactly what she wants to achieve through Kiva loans, which is her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to fix up her location and offer her customers comfort to promote loyalty.

loans.use: to buy cement and veneers.

loans.name: Zarzalosa Group

texts.es: Ramón, tiene  30 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio  de Intibucá.  Tiene más de 5 años de cultivar maíz, frijoles y café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal por 7,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para asistir su finca de café y mejorar la producción. Su plan es generar más ingresos para mejorar su vivienda. El grupo se llama Zarzalosa, formado por 7 miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo grupal es por 43,000 lempiras y lo utilizaran para fertilizar la finca de café. En la foto se identifican así: sentados a la izquierda está Fermín, Maria  y José Vicente, atrás está Jose Nolasco a la izquierda, Ramón, Julio y Juan a la derecha.
texts.en: Ramón is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in a town that belongs to the municipality of Intibucá. He has  more than 5 years' experience growing corn, beans and coffee. He sells his harvest in the local market. He has asked for a group loan of 7,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer to help his coffee and improve production. His plan is to generate more income to do home improvement. The group is called Zarzalosa, made up of 7 members who live in the same community and work in farming. The group loan is for 43,000 lempiras and they will use it to fertilizer the coffee farm. They are identified this way in the photo: seated from the left is Fermín, Maria  and José Vicente. Behind them is Jose Nolasco on the left, Ramón, Julio and Juan on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help his coffee farm.

loans.name: Rialyn

texts.en:
Rialyn has operated a retail store since 2009. She is 30 years of age, happily married, and has two children. She and her husband aspire to have a stable source of income, so they can educate their two children. 

She would also like to complete the merchandise she offers in her store. With her determination to obtain her goals in life, she decided to seek additional capital of PHP 5,000 which will be used to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and assorted biscuits for her general store. She hopes that with her requested loan, she will be able to obtain a better income and satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: to be used to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and assorted biscuits for her general store

loans.name: Felomena

texts.en: Felomena,  58 years old, is a hog raiser and fish vendor within her locality. She is married and blessed with six children; three of them are married, one is studying and two are working. Felomena plans to increase her sales, so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 9,000. She will use this loan to buy hog feed for her hog raising business and 20 kilograms of crabs and shrimps for her food vending activity. Felomena hopes to use the loan to increase her income, which enables her to sustain the family's daily needs, to provide medicines for her husband and to let her one child finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and 20 kilograms of crabs and shrimps

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa, 45 years old, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Nimfa works very hard to provide for them. For the past 3 years, Nimfa has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Nimfa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Neng Neng

texts.en:
Neng Neng is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 3 years. She earns additional income from food vending. Neng Neng is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase stock, such as soap, milk, eggs, chips, canned goods, etc. to sell in her store. 

Neng Neng has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock, such as soap, milk, eggs, chips, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 40 years old, and married with two children who are in school.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, bread, etc.  Lorna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Merabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Merabelle works hard to support her family. She has a business selling live fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Merabelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase different fish to sell for her business. 

Merabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase different fish to sell

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en: Jessa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a business making dried fish in the Philippines for the past 5 years. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to dry. Jessa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to be dried

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Doña Gladis, tiene 50 años de edad, es  casada, tiene  2 hijos y  vive en una  aldea del municipio de Santa Bárbara.  Lleva 9 años de  dedicarse  a la agricultura de maíz frijoles y café, el cual vende en la misma zona.  Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para abonar, fumigar y limpiar su finca, con el propósito de mejorar la producción. Su plan es seguir obteniendo ingresos para darles educación  a sus hijos y tener más fincas de café.
texts.en: Gladis is 50 years old, married, has two children, and lives in a town in the municipality of Santa Bárbara.  For nine years she has been farming corn, beans, and coffee, which she sells in the same area.  This business is her source of income.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 lempiras, which she will invest in fertilizers and supplies to fertilize, fumigate, and clean her farmland in order to improve her production.  Her plan is to keep making income to educate her children and have more coffee plantations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies to fertilize, fumigate, and clean her coffee plantation

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en:
A $800 loan is offered to Virgina to improve her business. She is married, and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy supplies everyday. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, and shampoo. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Virgina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cofffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is 37 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business- raising pigs in the Philippines. Melrose requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melrose has been raising pigs for three years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melrose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her transport business.  Mildred has been in this business for four years. She also earns income from buying and selling dried fish.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Loren works hard to support her family.

She sells personal products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from providing jeep transportation. Loren is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more personal products like body lotion, shampoo, and other items.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products like body lotion, shampoo, and other items.

loans.name: America

texts.es: América mujer de 52 años de edad, habita en un municipio de playa, brisa y mar, que es lo mas bello de esa tierra, que  inspira a América  para diseñar artesanías y generar ingresos  vendiéndolos a  los turistas y a habitantes de este municipio. Su negocio inició desde hace 21 años, cuando una buena amiga le enseñó las técnicas artesanales,  aprovechando los productos del mar como conchas marinas, esqueletos de caracol y piedras. Los principales productos los vende en su punto de ventas, directamente a los consumidores finales, que son principalmente taxistas y a vendedoras que distribuyen mediante ventas a crédito y de contado. Su meta es ampliar la oferta de sus productos para generar más ingresos y lograr el desafío de remodelar su vivienda. En la actualidad América se encuentra aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un horno refractario y materia prima  para elaborar nuevos diseños, aprovechando que se acercan las vacaciones y el turismo aumenta así como  también sus ventas si logra tener inventario de sus artesanías.
texts.en: América is a 52-year-old woman.  She lives in a municipality of beaches, breeze, and ocean, which are the world's most beautiful things.  They inspire América to design handicrafts and generate income by selling them to tourists and residents of her municipality.  She started her business 21 years ago when a good friend taught her crafting techniques making use of ocean products, such as seashells, snail shells, and rocks.  She sells her main products at her point of sale directly to the final consumers, who are mainly taxi drivers, and to vendors who distribute through credit and cash sales.  Her goal is to expand her sales offerings to generate more income and be able to remodel her home.  América is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a fire-resistant kiln and raw material to make new designs and take advantage of the coming holidays.  Tourism increases and so will her sales if she has handicraft inventory.

loans.use: to buy a fire-resistant kiln and raw material

loans.name: Karla Osiris

texts.es: Karla, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Tiene  dos años de haber establecido su propio negocio de venta de sandalias para damas de todo tipo. Las ventas las realiza enfrente a una maquila. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de un lote de sandalias tipo  playera, para vender en la temporada de verano.  Su plan es poder crecer con el negocio y mejorar  su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Karla, 21, lives in a civil union with her husband and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes. Two years ago, she started her own business in selling all types of sandals for women. She sells in front of a factory.

She is requesting a loan for 10,000 HNL to invest in buying beach sandals to sell this summer. Her plan is to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a batch of beach sandals to sell.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
At 34, May is now a widow mother of one child. Her kid is in elementary level of education. May is engaged in selling frozen foods like hot dogs and tocino (a pork product). May wishes to continuously operate the business so she has a continuous source of income. She wanted to earn more for the preparation of her child's college education soon. 

She doesn’t expect anybody to help her financially, that’s why she diligently manages her business. May wishes for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more hot dogs and tocino to sell. She will manage her business well which will assure her to earn profits for their future.

loans.use: to buy more hot dogs and tocino to sell

loans.name: Sadelyn

texts.en: Sadelyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sadelyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, bamboo, and paint for the maintenance of her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 10 years now.  In the future, Sadelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, bamboo, and paint for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 44 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Rosario works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosario is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. Rosario hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 53 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Josephine has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 40,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more dried fish to sell. Josephine has been in this business for seventeen years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Jose, tiene 22 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Esparta Atlántida, con su esposa e hijo. José anteriormente trabajaba con la ganadería pero en busca de obtener mas ingresos decidió con su esposa establecer su propio negocio de pulpería, desde hace mas de  4 años vende productos básicos como harina, azúcar, manteca, jabón, café, sal, arroz, pastillas, condimentos y otros abarrotes. Actualmente ha establecido su propio taller de bicicletas y venta de accesorios y repuestos, el cual le genera mejores ingresos. Lleva el cuarto ciclo de préstamo para mantener su negocio. El préstamo es por 15,000 lempira que lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos y accesorios para bicicletas para reparación y venta de repuestos. Su meta es mantener su negocio para tener bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Jose is 22 years old, married, has one child, and lives in the municipality of Esparta Atlántida with his wife and son.  José used to work with livestock, but in order to make more income, he and his wife decided to start their own grocery business.  For over four years they have been selling staple products, such as flour, sugar, lard, soap, coffee, salt, rice, pills, condiments, and other groceries.  He has now set up his own bike repair shop where he sells accessories and parts and it has generated better income for him.  He is using his fourth loan cycle to maintain this business.  The loan is for 15,000 lempiras, which he will invest in bicycle parts and accessories to be used for repairs and parts sales.  His goal is to maintain his business for his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts and accessories for sales and repairs.

loans.name: Pom's Group

texts.en:
Pom is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She is 45 years old and a mother of five children. 

To overcome the financial burden in her family, she does cassava and rice farming as her main source of income. It is the business that she has been in for 25 years. Pom has been a former borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past four loans, which has been completely repaid back and it has enabled her to improve her standard of living better. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a loan. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and plowing fees. She strongly hopes that she will earn a better income than before.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and plowing fees

loans.name: Lumturi

texts.en:
Lumturi is a 40-year-old mother of two who is requesting this loan to invest in olive groves.  

Lumturi sells at the local market in the nearby city of Elbasan. She sells olive fruit and olive oil, oranges and peaches, and seasonal and other green leafy veggies that she grows in a little greenhouse she has built in the backyard. She also sells fresh eggs and raw milk from her dairy cows. In addition to this agricultural work, she collects and sells some wood used for handicrafts. “I do all these activities with my husband. If I were all on my own, it would be difficult because the kids are very young and they need care as well,” said Lumturi to the branch assistant who interviewed her.

loans.use: to invest in olive groves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an electric saw.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet owns a retail store within her locality. She is 41 years of age, married to an electrician, and blessed with two children. Juliet is also engaged in hog raising and an electrical repair shop.The couple are grateful with the improvements of the businesses they manage.

Juliet wishes to have a grocery store someday. To make her dreams come true, she decided to request a loan of PHP 13,000. She will use this amount to buy stocks of grocery items such as cooking oil, canned goods, detergent soaps, soft drinks, and ingredients. She knows that someday she could fulfill her dreams because she's doing her best to improve her living conditions and gain a greater income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana manages an ironworks business, making of steel windows and aluminum doors. She has been managing the business for nine years.  Her earnings from it usually sustain their daily expenditures. Marciana has four children attending to school. Her husband is her partner in managing their business.  She does painting, while her husband is the one who fixes and makes the designs of their customer’s orders.  Marciana would like to receive more projects from her customers, and to increase her earnings too, but she can’t pursue them because she doesn’t have enough capital to fund them. In this connection, Marciana is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy metal and paints for the business. She hopes to earn more income and develop the business.

loans.use: to buy metal and paints for the business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37-years-old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase shampoo, soap, spices, eggs, noodles, cream, etc. to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soap, spices, eggs, noodles, cream, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling mse and natasha products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Fe is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her direct selling mse and natasha products business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 45-years-old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nida has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bethyan

texts.es: Desde muy niña a Bethyan, le llamó la atención elaborar vestidos, por eso cuando estuvo adulta y finalizo su estudio de bachiller, hizo caso a su inclinación natural y fue a la universidad  y estudió diseño de confecciones y cuando terminó hace 3 años, emprendió su propio negocio, que hoy es un taller donde confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, sobre los pedidos que hacen sus clientes. En su taller trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche sin cesar y de lunes a domingos porque tiene como meta, mas adelante,  tener una gran fabrica de costura.  En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos, botones, e insumos para trabajar nuevos diseños en su taller. Con ello logrará tener un inventario de productos y generar oportunidades entre sus clientes de comprarle a crédito, en plazos pactados con él, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa..
texts.en:
Since she was a young girl, Bethyan was called to making clothes. Therefore, when she became an adult and finished her high school studies, she paid attention to her natural calling and went to the university and studied clothing design. When she finished 3 years ago, she learned her own business, which today is a shop where she makes clothing for women, men and kids for orders that her customers make. In her workshop she works from 7 in the morning to 8 at night without stopping, from Monday to Sunday.

Her goal is to have a large sewing workshop in the future. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan that she is making from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this she will buy fabric, thread, buttons and supplies to work new designs in her shop. With this, she will achieve having an inventory of products and generate opportunities among her customers to buy from her on credit, in installments promised to her, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 57 años de edad, hace 20 años emprendió el montaje de un taller de confecciones, siguiendo su inclinación natural hacia el desempeño de esta tarea. En su negocio se realizan todas las operaciones del proceso de confecciones  para elaborar una prenda de vestir que finalmente vende a crédito entre sus vecinos, de barrio y de otros sectores donde está ubicada. Ester desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y de lunes a domingos, trabaja sin descanso para lograr un acabado perfecto y mantener a sus clientes fieles a su servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará una recubridora y materias primas e insumos, para afinar el acabado de las prendas que produce  y lograr trabajar con telas que solo resisten la maquina industrial. Con esta inversión logrará tener éxito porque se ahorra el costo, que ocurre cuando necesita mandar a acabar la prenda en otros talleres y con la recubridora podrá a su vez generar nuevos ingresos, ofreciendo este servicio a otras confeccionistas que no cuentan con este equipamento.
texts.en: Esther, 57 years old, started her own sewing shop 20 years ago, following her natural inclinations toward this kind of work. In her job, she carries out every step of the process of making garments, which she will sell on credit to her neighbors, throughout the neighborhood, and in other areas near where she lives. Esther works tirelessly from 7 o'clock in the morning until 8:00 at night, Monday through Sunday, to complete her work and keep her customers loyal to her.  Currently, she is applying for this loan from Kiva, her first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy a covering machine, as well as materials and other supplies. She needs these things so that she do the finishing on certain garments she makes and successfully work with fabrics that won't cooperate with industrial machines. This investment will help her reach success because she will save money on the costs of sending the garment out to be finished in other shops. Also, with the covering machine, she can earn additional income by providing services beyond what other seamstresses who don't have this kind of machine can provide.

loans.use: buy a covering machine as well as other materials and supplies for sewing.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en: Adelia is 56 years old, and widowed with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines. Adelia requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her business. She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Adelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her business.

loans.name: El Pilon Group

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Desde muy pequeño ha trabajado en la agricultura junto a su padre. Hace 6 años decidió por tener su propia finca de café, esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo en forma grupal, por 7,500 Lempiras y lo va invertir en compra de fertilizantes, foliares e insumos para darle buena asistencia a su finca de café. El grupo se llama El Pilon, esta formado por cuatro miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo grupal es por 25,000 Lempiras y lo invertirán en fertilizar y limpiar el cultivo de café. en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta María Alejandrina, le sigue Carlos, Juan y Danilo a la derecha.
texts.en:
Carlos, 26 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife. Together they have two children and live in the town of Gracias Lempira. Ever since he was little, he has worked at farming alongside his father. Six years ago, he decided to start his own coffee plantation, the produce from which he sells at a local market. He is requesting his second loan as part of a group. The loan is for 7,500 lempiras, and he will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers, herbicides, and other supplies that will help his coffee plantation.

The group is called El Pilon, and it is comprised of four members who all live and farm in the same community. The group loan is for 25,000 lempiras and they will invest it in fertilizing and cleaning their coffee fields.  The people in the photo are, from the left, María Alejandrina, Carlos, Juan , and Danilo.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, herbicides, and other supplies for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Muoy's Group

texts.en: Originally a farmer from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Muoy is 37-years-old and a mother of three kids. Currently, two of them are in school. The main source of her income is from cassava farming which she has been involved in for 19 years. This is the third cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past two loans, which she has fully repaid, has helped her family with sufficient food and a better living than before. For this cycle, she is a team leader of seven members to get the loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 10,600,000, which 2,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees for her farmland. She hopes that her rice will produce a good crop yield than before and she will be able to buy a paddy of farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees for her farmland

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 64 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Margarita recorre todos loa días las principales zonas de su localidad para comercializar su venta de pescado. Tiene 35 años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que muchas personas la conocen y demanda el rico pescado que con mucho esfuerzo ofrece. Margarita solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una galera para la cocina. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poco a poco ir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Margarita is 64 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children.  Margarita goes out every day to the major areas of her town to sell the fish she cooks. She has 35 years of experience in this line work, so a lot of people know her and demand the delicious fish that she works so hard to make. Margarita is requesting this loan from FUSAI to build a room onto her kitchen. With the requested amount, she will buy corrugated steel and wood. She hopes that she can count on this support to improve the conditions of her home a little at a time.

loans.use: buy corrugated steel and wood to build an area onto her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build walls and a concrete floor around her bathroom.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita offers snacks and native cakes to her local community. She sells on a house-to-house basis. It has been three years since she started this business. Now she plans to increase her stock of glutinous flour, sugar, cooking oil, salt, raw meat and vegetables as she has had to increase her inventory of native cakes, vegetables and raw meat that she offers; however, her capital is not enough. So, she is asking for financial assistance amounting to 5,000 PHP. She is hoping to avail this loan amount to keep her business profitable. In this way, she could educate her three children and sustain their daily basic commodities.

loans.use: to buy glutinous flour, sugar, cooking oil and salt as well as raw meat and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.es: Eufracia se dedica a la venta de repuesto de automóviles y motocicletas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo repuesto como por ejemplo pitones, llantas, tornillos, empaques y otras cosas mas, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Eufracia works selling car and motorcycle parts. She needs a loan in order to buy merchandise, for example wheel nuts, bolts, tyres, gaskets, and other items. She is committed to making her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy parts to sell, such as wheel nuts, bolts, tyres and gaskets.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 44 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to resell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Rowena has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia works hard to support her family. Alicia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to resell like chips, noodles, eggs, soap, sugar, etc. Alicia has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to resell like chips, noodles, eggs, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jose Everling

texts.es: Jose, tiene 36 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de las Flores, Lempira. El tiene 19 años de dedicarse a cultivar café. Dicha producción es vendida a intermediarios que llegan a la zona a comprar café. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. Ha mantenido sus cultivos mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, el actual que solicita es el sexto ciclo y es por 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, abonos, y resiembra de plantas de café. Su meta es seguir ampliando su finca para obtener mejor cosecha e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Jose is 36 years old, and is married with two children. He lives in a village outside of the town of Flores, Lempira. He has 19 years of experience at growing coffee, which he sells to various intermediaries who come to the area to buy coffee beans. This work is his source of income. He has maintained his crops through the investments from various loans. The current one is his sixth, and it is for 20,000 Lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers, manure and in the replanting of his coffee crop. His goal is to continue expanding his farm so that he gets a bigger harvest and great income for his family.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer, manure, and replanting of his coffee plants.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Perlita is 36-years-old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Perlita requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

Perlita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María tiene 48 años de edad y es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 14 años, 12 años, 10 años y 8 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de embutidos (chorizos y longanizas) de forma ambulante. Tiene 20 años de realizar esta actividad y gracias a los buenos productos y precios accesibles que ofrece muchas personas la prefieren. María desea terminar un muro de retención el cual por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. María espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder proteger sus pocas pertenencias y a su querida familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 and is the single mother of four children of 14, 12, 10 and 8. Maria works selling cold cuts (chorizo and other sausages) as a street vendor. She has been carrying out this activity for 20 years, thanks to good products and accessible prices that she offers many people who prefer her.

Maria wishes to finish a retention wall, which for lack of economic resources she has not achieved finishing. Because of this, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks and iron. Maria hopes to be able to count on this support and therefore be able to protect her few belongings and her dear family.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, bricks and iron to construct a retention wall.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: María Antonieta se dedica a la venta de pasajes de transporte inter provincial de la ruta Paucartambo a Cusco, entonces ella y sus hijas abrieron una tienda de venta de regalos y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar regalos como por ejemplo perfumes, libros, colonias, aretes, peluches para esta campaña dia de la madre que se está acercando.
texts.en: María Antonieta works selling tickets for travel between Paucartambo and Cusco, and has also opened a gift shop with her daughters. She needs a loan in order to buy gifts, such as perfumes, colognes, books, earrings, and stuffed animals, ready for the Mother's Day season.

loans.use: to buy gifts for sale ready for Mother's Day, such as perfumes, colognes, books, earrings, and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa se dedica a la venta de útiles como por ejemplo lapiceros, cuadernos, lápices, borradores, papeles, libros y otros cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en uno de los  bancos comunales de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos y libros, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa makes her living selling supplies like pens, notebooks, pencils, erasers, paper, books and other things. She is a responsible person and for this reason she was invited to participate in one of the village banks of Arariwa Association.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy notebooks and books. She is thankful and values the loan and she promises to fulfill the payment of her monthly installments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and books.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a happy person who lives peacefully with her husband. She has two children who are working abroad. Carmelita is 50 years of age and is married. Her husband runs their tricycle for passenger transportation. Carmelita engages in retailing grocery items. She enjoys managing it and has for almost five years. According to her, remittances from her children are enough to sustain their needs, but she wanted to have own source of income because she will not always depend on her children's sustenance. Because of this, Carmelita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy grocery items to resell. She will continue managing her business and aims to grow it.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Edwin Martes

texts.es: Edwin pertenece al banco comunal "Señor de los Nevados" y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo, él es una persona honrada y responsable que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y otras más, él saca adelante a su familia y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, él esta agradecido por la oportunidad y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad los pagos.
texts.en: Edwin belongs to the "Señor de los Nevados" village bank and lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo. He is an honorable and responsible person who makes his living in agriculture, animal husbandry and other things. He gets his family ahead and on this occasion, he needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. He is thankful for the opportunity and promises to pay the installments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a boarding house business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy wood, nails, paints, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her boarding house.  She has been in this business for three years now. Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, paints, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her boarding house.

loans.name: Nelson Orlando

texts.es: Nelson tiene 41 años de edad y reside junto a su esposa. Él se dedica a la prestación de servicios de fontanería dentro de su comunidad. Tiene 5 años de ganarse la vida mediante este oficio y es así como mantiene la economía del hogar. Nelson solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo del corredor de la vivienda puesto que se encuentra deteriorado y desea repararlo antes de que el invierno llegué. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Nelson is 41 years old and lives with his wife. He works offering plumbing services in his local community. He has made his living this way for the last five years, and this is how he maintains his household. He is seeking this loan via FUSAI in order to invest in repairing the roof of his home. It is currently in a dilapidated condition and he wishes to repair it before winter arrives. He will use the loan to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear items, cosmetics, and plastic goods.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer works hard to support her family. Jennifer is married and has a buy and sell chicken business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more chicken to resell. She has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken to resell.

loans.name: Echo De Miniere 1, 2,3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Smith est le coordonateur de son groupe Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4. Il n´est pas marie et il a 2 enfants. Il habite dans la region nord d´Haïti de électricité est rare et de L´eau portable est très limité. Il dirige son commerce de produit divers, et va acheter des chaussures, cosmétiques, vêtements, entre autres pendants les 6 derniers années Avant de ce commencer ce commerce il était Etudiant. 

Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, boisson, pépé, chabon, produit alimentaires, etc. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera a voyager dans les autres pays.
texts.en:
Smith is Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group's coordinator. He is unmarried and has two children. He lives in northern Haiti [where] electricity is rare and clean drinking water is very limited. He has been managing a business selling various products for the past six years and will purchase shoes, cosmetics, and clothing, among other items. Before beginning this business, Smith was a student.

Smith hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Other members of Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics, soda, drinks, secondhand clothing, charcoal, foodstuffs, etc. Smith says that his primary goal is to have a larger business that will help him travel to other countries.

loans.use: To purchase various goods (shoes, clothing, etc.).

loans.name: Doris Nilsa

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito  Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.
En este lugar vive la señora Doris, tiene 54  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Doris es una mujer muy trabajadora que para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  sabanas, cortinas, fundas de almohadas entre otros productos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella a deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la compra en Picoaza en un lugar que le dejan a buen precio y en ocasiones viaja a Guayaquil. Tiene más de 21 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual siempre le ha ayudado a su marido a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, sabanas, cortinas fundas de almohada, entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de gran ayuda. Sus sueños es tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The loan group Picoaza meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portviejo, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional fiestas of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history that its mountains enclose.

Señora Doris lives in this place. She is 54 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three adult children. The youngest of them still lives with her. Her husband is a driver.

Doña Doris is a very hard-working woman, who, in order to earn something on her own account and with this to help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing of all types, sheets, curtains, and pillow covers, among other products. Her form of sales is door to door, and she also sells in her home, where her best known customers come. She leaves items on credit with her customers and collects every week. She buys her merchandise in Picoaza in a place that gives her good prices, and on occasion she travels to Guayaquil. She has been in this business for more than 21 years, and with it she has always helped her husband to get ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing, sheets, curtains, and pillow covers, among other items. She has been in the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because the loans are a big help for her. Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sheets, curtains, pillow covers etc., to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to resell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to resell. Mary Grace has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to resell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Shyara Icyerekezo Cb Group

texts.en: Anathalie is 29 years old. She is a group leader of Icyerekezo, which means “Vision” in English. The group members do different kinds of businesses but they have the same common vision of changing the lives of themselves and the entire community. Anathalie has been selling clothes and shoes for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes and shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Alili

texts.en:
Alili is twenty years old with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alili's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Alili has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Alili has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Alili is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 36 years old and married with three children. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to resell. Elena has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Elena aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a clean cooking solution from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a clean and efficient cooking solution from Liquefied Petroleum Gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as galvanised sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his home and build a wall.

loans.name: Edith Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer de condición humilde, pero muy trabajadora, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de golosinas a las afueras de un colegio de su ciudad de lunes a viernes y sábados y domingos ofrece sus productos en su vivienda; asimismo de haber algún evento aprovecha para poder vender sus golosinas; de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder sacar adelante a sus 2 hijas.

Milagros esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como golosinas al por mayor, entre las cuales son chizito, chocolates, caramelos, wafer, entre otros y de esta manera poder mejorar sus venta y sus ingresos; así podrá seguir trabajando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder darle una profesión a sus hijas”.
texts.en:
Milagros is a woman from a humble background. She is a hardworking woman who, through great effort, started a business of selling snack foods outside of a school in the city. She works Monday through Friday, but on Saturdays and Sundays she sells products from her home. At the same time, she knows of some event that she can take advantage of for selling snacks. This enables her to earn income so that she can cover her household expenses and help her two daughters move forward.

Milagros is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, which includes snacks in bulk such as cheese curls, chocolates, caramels, wafers, and other products. This will allow her to improve her sales and her earnings. Milagros continues to work toward fulfilling her greatest wish of seeing her daughters pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy snack foods in bulk.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en: Annalyn is forty years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family's home were wiped out. Annalyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to buy building materials and pay for construction labor in order to build a house for her family. She has been a NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her buy and sell fish business. With your help, Annalyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Regina has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Regina requested a 28,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Regina has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ruby May

texts.en:
Ruby May is a 42-year-old married mother of eight children. Five of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ruby May has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Ruby May requested a 11,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Ruby May has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ruby May would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlene's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Arlene is taking out a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Arlene has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she could build a house for her family. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion works hard to support five children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency. Salvacion is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina is 19 years old, single, and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Charina's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Charina is taking out a 9,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Charina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jumrah

texts.en:
Opening a business is a struggle; sometimes you are up and sometimes you are down. This has been the experience of Jumrah who has a small kiosk business. Sometimes he has a lot of customers, but other times there are quiet moments. The variation has certainly affected the revenue of his business and directly affected his repayments on his loan; however, Jumrah is very responsible with his obligations and was able to repay his loan.

In order to increase his income, Jumrah is taking on new loans. He plans to open a new business which will be to grow corn in his garden. It is now the rainy season, the perfect time to plant corn. He will use his loan to purchase corn seed. The small kiosk business is still running, and he hopes that the income from the garden will earn him additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mary Jane has a business selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 58 years old, married and has 12 children. 

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 44 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Remedios has a general store business in the Philippines. Remedios requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for three years. In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Eleonor has been in this business for five years.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Delia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old and lives with four children. With children in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Delia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Delia has taken a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Delia is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 62 years old and has four children. Diosdada is married and has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Diosdada has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. 

With your help, Diosdada can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Angelita is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

Angelita has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Elena's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Elena is taking out a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Elena has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Elena would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kimsin's Group

texts.en:
Kimsin is aged 44 years and married with four children. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing mushrooms. To add more income, her husband also works as a policeman. 

Kimsin has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Elsie  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 53 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elsie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elsie has taken a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elsie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 43 years old and has four children. Elvira is married and has two children who are in school.

Elvira and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Elvira is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Elvira has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Elvira can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is fifty seven years old and married with six children with one child in school. Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Carmen has since restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Carmen has taken a 8,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Carmen is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to send her children in college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Kim is a 33-year-old married mother of one child who is too young for school. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for 15 years. To better support the family, she works as a paid worker in the village. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.
 
Kim has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Kim wants to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina se sigue dedicándose a la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, fierros, ladrillos,  arena, yeso, piedra chancada y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena y cemento.

Ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión de libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en uno de los bancos comunales de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Segundina continues to earn her living selling construction materials such as cement, reinforcing bars, bricks, plaster, crushed stone. She will use this loan to buy materials such as sand and cement.

She is 29 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has two children. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who keeps her family moving forward with the effort she puts into her work. She is a responsible person, and for this reason she was invited to participate in one of the Asociación Arariwa communal banks.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Almera

texts.en:
Almera is 35 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Almera is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Almera has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Nim is aged 44 years and married. She has five children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and making palm juice for several years and they supplement the family’s income by working as paid workers. The current business earns them about US$10 per day and they manage to save about US$6 each day for future needs.

This is the first microloan for Nim with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for her family’s commuting. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a new motorbike so as to reduce taxi expenses.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family’s commuting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo pertenece al banco comunal "Señor de los Nevados" y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo, él es una persona honrada y responsable que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y otras cosas más, él saca adelante a su familia y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, él esta agradecido por la oportunidad y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad los pagos.
texts.en: Guillermo is a member of the Señor de los Nevados communal bank, and lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo. He is an honest and responsible person. He earns his living with agriculture, livestock, and other activities, and works hard to provide the best for his family. He needs a loan in order to buy seed and fertiliser. He is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to make the repayments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertiliser.

loans.name: Annie Jean

texts.en:
Annie Jean is 20 years old and lives in Jimenez Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is single and presently studying in one of the universities of her town as one of the graduating students.

Annie Jean is receiving support from her father working as a glass window and sliding doors installer, earning approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She is also being supported by her sisters for her monthly school fees and other needs. She has requested a loan to be used in paying the tuition fees and satisfy the graduation requirements to complete her courses. Annie Jean became a member of PMPC just this year. Annie Jean hopes to become a successful employee in the future.

loans.use: to be used in paying the tuition fees and satisfying the graduation requirements to complete her courses.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

Erlinda's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost.
