Erlinda is taking out a PHP 5000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her house for her family.

Erlinda has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Juana Adela

texts.es: Juana tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 16 años, 15 años y 12 años de edad. Juana se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado por causa del tiempo y las lluvias. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera, vara de castilla, y teja.
texts.en: Juana is 47 years old and lives in her own house with three children ages 16, 15, and 12. Juana has worked in housekeeping services for a long time and that's how she has maintained her household. With the goal of improving the condition of the house she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof, since it has deteriorated due to age and rain. As a result she has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of wood, reeds, and tiles.

loans.use: To purchase: wood, tiles, and reeds

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 17 años, 15 años y 6 años de edad. María se gana la vida mediante la venta de tamales y pan dulce de forma ambulante. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 5 años por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir  en la construcción de un muro de retención para el cual necesita comprar materiales como: cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children ages 17, 15, and 6. Maria makes a living by selling tamales and pastries as a street vendor. She's done her selling as a street vendor for five years so she has lots of experience and customers that have become increasingly loyal every day. Maria is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a retaining wall for which she needs to purchase materials like: cement, bricks, sand, and iron. She hopes to receive this financing so she can start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase: Cement, bricks, sand, and iron to build a retaining wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase: galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the house's hallway

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase: cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and wood to repair the roof and pave the house's floor

loans.name: Conis Elizabeth

texts.es: Conis tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo. Conis se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa nueva. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y de forma fija desde hace tres años. Conis es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y sobre todo responsable. Conis solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila, un baño lavable y su respectiva ducha. Con el crédito solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, grava y de más artículos necesarios para la construcción. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Conis is 22 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and young child. Conis makes a living by selling new clothes, and the selling has been done as a street vendor and from a fixed location for three years. Conis is a woman who's industrious, hardworking, and above all responsible. Conis is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a sink and a washable bathroom with its own shower. She'll use the requested loan to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, gravel, and other items necessary for construction. She hopes to receive this financing so she can start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase: cement, sand, bricks, iron, gravel and other necessary items for the construction of a sink with a washable bathroom.

loans.name: Maria Rosibel

texts.es: María tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 5 años y un año de edad. María habita en condiciones muy humildes y trabaja muy duro para apoyar con la economía del hogar. María se dedica a la venta de fruta picada en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace dos años. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño sanitario para el cual necesita comprar materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, taza de cemento, madera y lámina. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacer el desembolso pero si tiene la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Maria is 24 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and two daughters, ages 5 and 1. She lives in very modest conditions and works hard to help with household expenses. Maria works in the sale of sliced fruit in different areas of her town. She has done her selling as a street vendor for two years. With the intention of improving her conditions she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bathroom for which she needs to purchase materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, a cement toilet bowl, wood, and sheet metal. She hopes to receive this financing because she doesn't have the financial means to make this expenditure but she is capable of making the monthly payment that the loan entails.

loans.use: To purchase: bricks, cement, sand, a cement toilet bowl, wood and sheet metal to build a bathroom

loans.name: Phoern

texts.en:
Phoern is aged 39 years and married with no kids. She is a farmer who has been growing rubber and cassava for 19 years. With the current business, she can earn about US$15 per day to meet her family’s needs and is able to save about US$9 each day after daily expenses. 
Phoern has just joined VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan to clear a field for crops. She hopes to grow her cassava and rubber so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to clear a field for crops

loans.name: Eulita

texts.en:
Eulita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Eulita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Josephine has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Josephine has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Josephine is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn is 53 years old and married with five children. He lives in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been his family’s main source of income for 33 years. To supplement the income, he has been working as a garment worker and sometimes working as a paid worker in the village. The current business earns him about 80,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Khorn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and he completely repaid the past loans. Now he is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work. He hopes to go to work on time.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Luis Ameth

texts.es: Es un hombre luchador y amable, con 3 hijos 2 mujeres y 1varon) adolescentes, en edad escolar; tiene 34 años, desde hace aproximadamente 17 años vive en una casita de madera y tambo, con un solo espacio, viviendo en hacinamiento con su familia. Con el propósito de tener su vivienda de concreto y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para techar y poner las ventanas y puertas de su vivienda de 22x38 pies que está construyendo poco a poco. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos y familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en: He's a hardworking and friendly man, with 3 teenage children (two girls and one boy) that are in school. He's 34 years old and for approximately 17 years has lived in a house made of wood and thatch with just one room, living life crowded together with his family. With the intention of having a home made of concrete and so that his family can live safely and respectably he's requesting his first loan to purchase materials to build a roof and install windows and doors in his 22 x 38 home that he's building bit by bit. His dream is to have a safe home with basic amenities for the comfort of his children and family in general. He wants to also equip his house with a toilet and build a septic tank, since he currently has a latrine in fair condition.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a roof and install windows and doors in his 22 x 38 home

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Phan is a 63-year-old married woman. She has eight children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 100,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 40,000 KHR each day for her future needs.
Phan has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely repaid the past loans. The past loans have helped Phan to better support her family and improve her business. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is aged 52 years and widowed with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for 15 years to make a living and she supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. With the current business, she can earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs and is able to save about 30,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 
This is Sam’s eighth loan with VisionFund. She successfully repaid the past loans which have helped her better support her family. She is going to apply for a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy various products including cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Maliro est une brave commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 8 ans, présidente et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Rafiki», âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des fruits dans un parking de vehicules à la sortie de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 4 régimes bananes plantains et 3 paniers d’avocats, etc. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un professionnel de la craie(Enseignant). Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit, pendant, cette période post conflits dans la région de l'Est du pays.
texts.en: Maliro is an honest tradeswoman. She is energetic and has been running a business for eight years. She is aged 35, married, and mother of three children all of whom go to school. She is the president and a member of the Rafiki business group. She sells fruit in a vehicle park on the edge of the town. She requests a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She would like to buy four bunches of plantain bananas and three baskets of avocados, etc. She started her business with money that was given to her by her husband. Her husband is a chalk professional (teacher). In the future she hopes to feed her children and send them to school. She thanks Hekima for their support by offering loans to women in business that are not bankable, especially during this time of post-conflict in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy four bunches of plantain banans and three baskets of avocados, etc.

loans.name: Twungubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Claudette fait partie du groupe  Twungubumwe II  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 44 ans et est mariée à Daniel, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants âgés de 4 à 23 ans. dont 8 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, limonade,…) depuis 7 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, limonade,…) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Claudette is a member of the Twungubumwe II group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 44 years old and is married to Daniel, a driver. They have nine children between the ages of four and 23, eight of whom go to school.

She has been selling in a shop (rice, beans, lemonade...) for seven years.

This is her eighth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of stock for her shop (rice, beans, lemonade...) for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of stock for her shop (rice, beans, lemonade...) for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Ayabavi

texts.fr: Ayabavi est une jeune dame de 35ans. Elle a pour conjoint un vétérinaire et mère d'un enfant d'01 an et demi. Pour aider son son mari, madame Ayabavi exerce comme activité la vente des produits de premières nécessités(riz, sucre, huile végétale ....) Disposant de nombreux clients et ne voulant pas les perdre, Ayabavi fait son sixième crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Les cinq derniers prêts ont été payés sans aucun souci. Elle espère devenir grossiste à l'avenir et participer de manière active à l'épanouissement de la famille. Ayabavi exerce cette activité depuis 2008.
texts.en: Ayabavi is a young woman of 35. She is married to a veterinary surgeon and has one child of 18 months. To help her husband, Mrs. Ayabavi sells primary need food products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil...). As she has many clients and does not want to lose them, Ayabavi is on her sixth loan to purchase merchandise. She repaid the five previous loans without any problems. She hopes to become a wholesaler in the future and contribute actively to the well-being of her family. Ayabavi has been in this business since 2008.

loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, stones and iron, and pay for the labor to build a composting latrine.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Madame Kossiwa vit avec son conjoint mécanicien et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des pagnes, mèches et produits de beauté de façon ambulante et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère réinjecter ses profits supplémentaires dans son activité et assurer la bonne scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. Kossiwa lives with her spouse, who is a mechanic, and their two children in Lomé. She sells traditional dresses, strands of hair, and beauty products as an itinerant saleswoman. She requests a first loan to buy merchandise. She hopes to re-inject the supplementary profits in her business and make sure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy traditional dresses, strands of hair, and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, sand, cement, iron, sheets, poles and a toilet bowl, and pay for the labor to build a toilet.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  MANCOURANI I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme CHATA debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Danaya, fait la vente des mèches. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 cartons de 12 unités de mèches  à BAMAKO pour la revendre en détail sur place et à  MANCOURANI I où elle dispose une boutique, à une clientèle composée des femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 46 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The seven members of the Danaya group are married women who are on average 44 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Mancourani 1, one of the popular quarters of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their 16th solidarity loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, in order to satisfy their customers' needs.
Mrs. Chata, who is standing first on the left in the photo of the Danaya women's group , sells strands of hair.
With her loan, she plans to buy five boxes of 12 units of strands in Bamako, for resale by retail locally and in Mancourani 1, where she has a shop, to her female customers for cash and for credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 46 000 francs CFA, which she will use in part to repay her loan and the interests and the remainder she will add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy strands of hair for women.

loans.name: Resurrection

texts.en:
Resurrection is fifty-seven years old and a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Resurrection's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Resurrection has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Resurrection has taken a 10000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Resurrection is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family .

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Soern is 51 years old and married with five children, two of whom are dependents. She lives in a rural village of the Bovel district where crop farming a common way to make a living. Rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for 13 years. To earn more, she has been working as a paid worker. She can earn about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, but she can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Soern’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and completely paid back the loans while her group partner has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans have helped her family with sufficient food and provided better support to her business. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nena Aura

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, soltera, vive con su mamá. Desde hace un año estableció una pequeña pulpería en la comunidad de Santa Martha, con su liquidación del trabajo que realizaba en una empresa. Con el propósito de ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción (Clavos, zinc, madera rustica y cepillada). Su sueño es creces como comerciante y llegar a tener la capacidad de comprar y vender ganado.
texts.en: Nena is from Puerto Cabezas. She is single and lives with her mother. A year ago, she established a little grocery store in the community of Santa Martha with her severance pay from the job she had with a company. With the goal of growing her business premises, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials (nails, zinc, worked and unworked wood). Her dream is to grow as a businesswoman and to have the capacity to buy and sell livestock.

loans.use: to grow her business premises.

loans.name: Patzulin 3 Group

texts.es:
Diego (el primero del lado izquierdo en la  fotografía) es un señor  de 54 años de edad, soltero, tiene  tres hijos de 16, 13 y 8 años de edad, ambos están estudiando, quienes viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
El es una persona trabajadora, comenta que cuando era niño ayudaba a sus padres al cultivo y a la venta de banano. El decidió seguir con este negocio que sus padres le enseñaron desde hace 50 años, ahora el obtiene un ingreso que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su familia a través de la actividad que realiza.  
El objetivo de Diego es contribuir con el desarrollo de su comunidad y es por ello que ha formado un grupo para poder mejorar la economía de sus familias. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos agrícolas, de esta manera podrán darle un mantenimiento adecuado al cultivo de banano.
Uno de sus mayores sueños es, comprar una cuerda de terreno para poder cultivar y así incrementar su ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego (on the left in the photograph) is a 54 year old man, single, and has three children who are 16, 13, and 8 years old and who are in school. They live in the department of Suchitepequez.
He is a hardworking person and tells us that, when he was little, he used to help his parents to grow and sell bananas. He decided to continue with this business that his parents taught him 50 years ago. Today he makes an income through this work that helps him to cover the household expenses.
Diego's goal is to contribute to the development of his community and so he has formed a group to improve the economy of the families in the community. He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies and so give his banana crops the right care. One of his major goals is to to buy some land to cultivate and so to increase his income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for his bananas.

loans.name: Derysi Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Aquí Hay Esperanza se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Deysi, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3  años. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña Deysi es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a solventar los gastos de hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Su forma  de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja los últimos tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella aprovecha para vender a pescadores cuando llegan a la playa ya que es cuando tienen mas dinero y pueden comprar, ella también le da una parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice para la pesca, tiene tres  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo y materiales de pesca. Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The loan group Aquí Hay Esperanza (Here There is Hope) meets every two weeks in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for it's beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here, the majority of people are very hardworking and have jobs related to the sea.
Deysi lives in this place. She is 24 years old and has a common law husband and a 3 year old son.  Her husband is a fisherman.
Deysi is a housewife who, to earn her own resources and help to cover the household expenses, sells all types of clothes. She sells door to door, working the last 3 days of the week. She sells her products on credit and and collects every week. She takes advantage of the opportunity to sell to fishermen when they arrive at the beach as this is when they have the most money and can buy things. She will also give part of the loan to her husband to use in his fishing business. She has been doing this work for 3 years so that she can earn something for the sake of her family. 
She will use this loan to buy all types of clothes and fishing supplies. She has been in the loan group for 2 years and she likes it because of the help that they give with the loans. Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fishing materials.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, 50, is married and has four children. 

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Rosalia is taking out a housing loan amounting to 5000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rosalia has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Rosalia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Denis Lorenzo

texts.es: Es un hombre trabajador, casado, tiene dos hijos: El mayor de 14 años cursa su cuarto año de secundaria y la niña de 8 años está en cuarto grado de primaria. Desde hace 6 años estableció  su taller de mecánica y vulcanización. Con el objetivo de ampliar su microempresa solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar un compresor de 60 galones de aire. Recuerda que inicio con 3 ayudantes, actualmente emplea a 5 jóvenes cuyo salario mensual aproximadamente es de C$ 3,500. Su sueño es ampliar sus conocimientos en mecánica automotriz y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Denis is a hardworking man, married, and he has 2 children: the oldest is 14 years old and in his fourth year of secondary school and the little girl is 8 years old and in the fourth grade of elementary school. He started his vehicle mechanic and vulcanization shop 6 years ago. He is requesting his first loan with the goal of growing his micro-enterprise by buying a 60 gallon air compressor. He remembers that he began with 3 helpers and he currently employs 5 young people whose monthly salary is about C$3,500. His dream is to become better known as an automotive mechanic and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a 60 gallon air compressor

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Aquí Hay Esperanza se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 13 y 12 años, dos de ellos  estudian  en colegio. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña Rosa para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto darles lo necesario a sus hijos  con la ayuda del primer crédito  que recibió del grupo surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, la cual la va aumentando poco a poco para satisfacer a sus clientes, allí vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas. Ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido compre lo necesario para la pesca.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres y materiales de pesca. Lleva 2 ciclos en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The loan group Aquí Hay Esperanza (Here There is Hope) meets every two weeks in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for the beautiful beaches that line the coast of this beautiful place. Here, the majority of the people are very hardworking and do work related to the sea. 
Rosa lives in this place. She is 31 years old and has a common law husband and 3 children who are 15, 13, and 12 years old. Two of them are in high school. Her husband is a fisherman.
To earn something of her own and to give her children what they need, Rosa started a little grocery store in her home with the first loan that her group received. She has been growing the business little by little in order to satisfy her customers. She sells rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and other things. She will also give part of the loan to her husband to buy fishing supplies. 
This loan will be used to buy groceries and fishing supplies. She has been in the loan group for 2 loan cycles and she likes it because she started her business with the loans. Her dream is to have a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a single mother of eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosario's house was destroyed by the super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her farming rice business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Rosario is taking out a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her family a house.

Rosario has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start over in a new home. In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 23 years old and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Roselyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Roselyn is taking out a PHP 9,500 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Roselyn has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Sarah Jane would like to save enough money to could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy, age 32, lives in a rural village of Battamabang province’s Moung Russey district in Cambodia. She is married and has three children. 

For the last 10 years, Vy has been working as a rice farmer while her husband has been working as a motor-taxi driver. Her current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Vy is in her second cycle as a client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use a portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn a greater income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Kaing's Group

texts.en:
Kaing lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province in Cambodia. She is 36 years old and married with two children. 

To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer and sometimes she works for others for a fee. Her current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day and she can afford to save 22,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is Kaing’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back her past loans. Now she is leading her group of two female members to apply for a loan. 

Kaing will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland as well as to pay for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to produce more healthy rice to increase her family’s income and to make better living. She hopes to be able to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, aged 70, is a hardworking man who is engaged in farming work in Kandal province. He grows rice and owns a banana plantation. Kim has been in this business for many years. Kim has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of his wife and children. Kim is photographed in the photo with his wife.

By applying for this loan Kim will use it to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members and so as to improve his household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Kim is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for his family members.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is fifty-six years old, married, and has six children.  

Susana and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 8,500 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Susana has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her fishing & farming rice.

With your help, Susana can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Vevenia

texts.en:
Vevenia is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vevenia is fifty years old and has one child who is in school.

Vevenia's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Vevenia  is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Vevenia has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Vevenia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stationary and recharge her vaults of M-Pesa to service more people..

loans.name: Sida's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sida is 41-year-old mother of four children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and she supplements her family’s income by selling grocery items. Her husband is a teacher. 

Having been in the farming business for 15 years, Sida can make a daily income of 150,000 Cambodian riels (KHR). After expenses, she is able to save about 30,000 KHR per day for future needs.

This is the eighth loan for Sida’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sida is leading her group in this request for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire an efficient cooking energy solution from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a Liquefied Petroleum Gas package as an efficient cooking energy

loans.name: Sanit

texts.en:
Sanit, 34, is married with two children who are attending school and are dependent on her. She earns a living by farming rice and other seasonal crops in the Banteay Meanchey province of Cambodia. 

She has been engaged in agriculture since she was a young girl and has learned the business from her parents and elder people. With the income from her current business, she aims to save enough for her business and for the future education of her children.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Sanit is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel Ángel continua con su negocio de cafetín escolar, él socio vende sus productos a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio vende golosinas, empanadas entre otros, él socio desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante cada día.
 El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de tortas, gaseosas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel continues to manage a school cafeteria as his business. He sells his products to all of his customers who request them. Miguel offers snack foods, empanadas, and other items. He wants to continue working so that he can get ahead each day.

Miguel Ángel is requesting a loan in order to buy sandwiches, sodas, and other items. He is grateful for the loan that has been given to him and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, sodas, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an affordable and efficient cooking energy solution using Liquefied Petroleum Gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, stone, two toilets, and to pay workers to build a composting toilet.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica  a la venta de medicina popular desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en su casa de habitación como también de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina popular por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and resides in her own home along with her family. She has been selling popular medicines for several years. Ana sells her products from her home, but she also travels as a street vendor to different neighborhoods near her home.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy popular medicines in bulk so that she can continue her sales. As a result, she will generate more income and be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy popular medicines in bulk.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo integran cuatro socios exitosos, coordinado por la señora Socorro de 40 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos de las edades  de 14, 7 y 4 años, se dedicada a comercializar ropa nueva y también es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para la venta de sus productos, con el crédito anterior logró impulsar la pulpería, esto le ha motivado a seguir prestando en esta institución. El crédito lo requiere para invertir en ropa como es camisetas, talladores, jean de caballeros, jean de damas, tobilleras, licras, entre otros, así mismo surtirá la pulpería comprando arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan, azúcar, galletas, gaseosas y más. Otra de las socias es la señora María de 34 años de edad dedicada a la crianza de cerdo para luego comercializarlos, la señora Alicia de 39 años de edad que se dedica a la crianza de cerdo y el señor Santiago de 32 años, brinda el servicio de transporte en su comunidad, debido a que es propietario de una moto taxi y es el medio más utilizado en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group consists of four successful members. Sra. Socorro is the group coordinator. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children (ages 14, 7, and 4). Socorro sells new clothes, but she is also the owner of a grocery store in her home. She has the help of her husband with selling her products. Her previous loan helped to propel her store, so she is motivated to continue seeking loans from ADIM. Socorro’s loan will be invested in clothing such as T-shirts, tank tops, men’s jeans, women’s jeans, anklets, spandex, and other items. She will also restock her grocery store by purchasing rice, beans, oil, bread, sugar, cookies, sodas, and other products.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. María is 34 years old and raises pigs that she eventually sells.
• Sra. Alicia is 39 years old and also raises pigs.
• Sr. Santiago is 32 years old and provides transportation services in his community. He is the owner of a motorcycle taxi, which is the most utilized mode of transportation in his community.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothing to sell and merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Geidy Elizeth

texts.es: Geidy es una mujer emprendedora y decida, tiene 25 años de edad y habita en el Barrio La Libertad. Su esposo labora como ayudante en un servicio de transporte pesado y algunas veces tiene que salir fuera de casa por varios días, juntos han están luchando por educar y su dos hijos que tiene un futuro por delante. Geidy aprendió las actividades de comercio de su madre, y hoy es elabora deliciosos productos lácteos que son comercializados desde hace varios meses en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, la cual será utilizada para la elaboración de cuajada, quesillo y crema, quien tiene una buena demanda en todo el país.
texts.en: Geidy is a determined and entrepreneurial woman.  She is 25 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Libertad.  Her husband works as a heavy transport assistant and at times has to travel away from home for several days.  Together they have been struggling to educate their two children so that they will have a better future.  Geidy learned her trade from her mother, and today she makes delicious milk products that she has been selling for severals months from a room in her home.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase milk, which she will use to make curds, cream cheese, and creme.  These items are in great demand throughout the country.

loans.use: To purchase milk which will be used to make curds, creme cheese and creme.

loans.name: Alex William

texts.es:
Alex William tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad situada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, también se dedican al comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar una pared de su vivienda y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alex William is 28 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Zaña, a community that lies near the valley of the Jequetepeque River. The conditions are suitable for agriculture to thrive, but the area is also known for trade and livestock breeding. This community is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Alex provides public transportation services with the use of a motorcycle taxi that he owns. He transports his passengers to the neighboring areas of his district. Alex is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN so that he can buy construction materials in order to finish a wall in his home. This will provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for finishing the construction of a wall in his home.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for a year and also earns an income from food vending. 

Josephine has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy shampoo, groceries and other items to sell. She has borrowed and paid one previous loan from NWTF. 

She aspires to saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries and other items to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 2,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap and chips.

Jocelyn has been in this business for a year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap and chips.

loans.name: Félix Benjamin

texts.es:
Félix de 60 años de edad,  es un empleado de la alcaldía municipal, como recolector de basura todos los días se levanta muy temprano para ir a su trabajo. Actualmente, esta casado su esposa también colabora con los gastos del hogar ya que también tiene una venta de tortillas en el mercado, él tiene 8 años de trabajar como recolector de basura en el tren de aseo, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres están yendo a la escuela y uno esta haciendo su primer año en el bachillerato.

La única fuente de ingresos que tiene es su empleo, puesto que ya lleva muchos años trabajando como recolector de basura en la alcaldía, el trabajo le queda bastante cerca como a una distancia de un kilómetro. Este empleo lo obtuvo gracias a un amigo que trabaja en la alcaldía y le dio la oportunidad de trabajar ya que su horario es un poco accesible,  puesto que trabaja de las 6:00AM hasta las 4:00PM.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para mejorar su vivienda, dado que ya se acerca la temporada de lluvias y su vivienda esta en muy malas condiciones; lo cual significa que puede tener muchas fugas de agua dentro de ella, ahora con su crédito él comprará laminas nuevas para tener su vivienda digna y segura. 

El sueño de Félix es que en esta temporada de lluvias su vivienda este mas segura y no le pase lo que le paso el año pasado que se mojaban él y sus hijos; por que la lamina estaba muy picada y habían muchas fugas de agua, él solo quiere que sus hijos y su esposa estén mas seguros y sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Félix is 60 years old and is an employee of the city mayor's office.  He collects trash every day and gets up very early to go to work.  Currently he is married to a woman who also collaborates with household expenses since she also sells tortillas at the market.  He has been working as a garbage collector for 8 years in the field of disposal services.  He has four children of whom three are still going to school and one is in his first year of high school. 

The only source of income that he has is his work, since he now has many years working as a garbage collector for the city.  His job is close by home, around a kilometer in distance.  He got this job thanks to a friend who worked for the city and who gave him the opportunity to work since the schedule is manageable. He works from 6am to 4pm. 

He is asking for a loan in order to make home improvements.  The rainy season is coming and his home is in poor condition, meaning that he could have many leaks.  With this loan he will buy new metal roofing sheets in order to make his home safe and dignified.  

Félix's dream is that during this rainy season his home will be safer and that he won't have the same problems he had last year with leaks troubling himself and his children.  The roof had many holes and there were lots of leaks.  He only wants his wife and children to be safer and he knows that he can make that happen with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase new metal sheets for covering the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase gems, stones, jewelry, and pay rent for her kiosk at the mall.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs and cream.

Imelda has been in this business for a year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs and cream

loans.name: Mangomango Group

texts.en:
Rose is a treasurer of the Mangomango group and is responsible for collecting and banking members' repayments. Rose is in her early forties and has two kids who are in school. She is a widow and makes her living by running a clothes business. She opens her business from 08:00 am to 09:00 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Rose's first loan request which she will use to buy new fashionable clothes for her business. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman. Rose will share this loan with her loan group "MANGOMANGO" which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kampala Group

texts.en:
Grace is in her early thirties and has three children (two boys and one girl) who are in school. She is coupled with somebody. For six years now Grace has managed a beauty salon. She opens her beauty salon from 08:00 am to 09:30 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Grace's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Grace used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to buy salon hair steamer and hair products. Grace used the increased income to cover part of school fees and home food expenses. She normally puts aside (saves) part of the business profit for her future. Grace is so happy with Kiva's loan support and she dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business and life. With her new loan request, Grace will use the money to buy salon hair products to service more people. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " KAMPALA" which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products to service more people.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 36 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Imelda runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business. She has been running the charcoal business for 9 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. Imelda has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dudung

texts.en:
Dudung runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Dudung lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Dudung is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Dudung began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali runs a small stall which sells snacks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. Ali lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Ali is married and living with three people in the family home. As seen in the picture: Ali with his daughter.

Ali began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Sorayda

texts.es: Es una mujer emprendedora, originaria de Moyogalpa, que llegó a Bilwi desde hace 24 años con sus padres y se estableció en este lugar. Tiene 29 años de edad, casada, todavía no tiene hijos. Con el propósito  de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 13 años estableció una pequeña  pulpería, en el porche de su vivienda en la que vende granos básicos, refrescos y otros. Su esposo hace pan y los vende en el negocio de ella. Hace año y medio organizó un grupo solidario para gestionar préstamos con PANA PANA, en el cual trabajó como coordinadora por 9 ciclos. Ahora que ha mejorado su capacidad de pago está solicitando financiamiento para comprar mercadería e incrementar el inventario de su negocio. Gracias a los financiamientos anteriores como grupo solidarios, le permitieron diversificar su negocio, actualmente vende nacatamal de pollo y cerdo de viernes a domingo y vende cosméticos por catálogos. Su sueño es llegar a ser dueña de un negocio próspero y grande.
texts.en: Sorayda is an entrepreneurial woman.  She is originally from Moyogalpa and moved from there to Bilwi 24 years ago along with her parents, who established themselves there. She is 29 years old and married, but she does not yet have children.  With the goal of earning her own income, 13 years ago she established a small corner store on the porch of her home where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, and other items.  Her husband makes bread and they sell it in her business.  A year and a half ago she organized a communal bank to work with loans offered through PANA PANA. She worked as the coordinator of the group for 9 loan cycles.  Now that she has improved her economic situation she is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise  and increase the inventory for her business.  Thanks to the previous loans with her communal bank, she has been able to diversify her business, and currently she sells chicken and pork tamales from Friday to Sunday and she sells makeup via catalogues.  Her dream is to become the owner of a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to increase the inventory of her business.

loans.name: Alicia Marlene

texts.es: Es una joven comerciante de 20 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de un año y medio de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, muy emprendedora. Su esposo también es un pequeño comerciante. Desde hace aproximadamente 7 años ella inició su propio negocio de venta de calzado y ropa nueva en el mercado municipal donde alquila un tramo. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería (zapatos para damas y niños, sandalias, short, camisolines, blusas, faldas y vestidos, entre otros). La mercadería la compra en Managua para venderla a precios accesibles en Bilwi. Su sueño es que su negocio continúe creciendo, estudiar costura y confeccionar ella misma  uniformes, togas y vender sus productos en su tramo, ir creando un ahorro para apoyar en el futuro la educación de hijo para que sea un joven profesional honesto.
texts.en: Alicia Marlene is a young 20 year-old business woman who is married with a one and a half year-old son. She is originally from Puerto Cabezas, and is very entrepreneurial.  Her husband is also a small business owner.  Approximately 7 years ago she began her own business selling shoes and new clothing in the city market where she rents a space.  She is asking for her first loan in order to buy merchandise (shoes for women and children, sandals, shorts, camisoles, blouses, skirts, and dresses, among other items).  She buys her merchandise in Managua in order to sell it at more accessible prices in Bilwi. Her dream is for her business to continue growing, to study sewing and to make her own uniforms and gowns and to sell her products in her store.  She wants to begin creating a savings fund for the education of her child so that he can be an honest professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes for women and children, sandals, shorts, camisoles, blouses, skirts, and dresses, among other items).

loans.name: Malakiah

texts.en:
Opening a coffee shop has been a long time dream for Malakiah and her business partner April.  From the tantalizing aroma of a fresh hand-poured coffee to the social buzz found at local coffee shops, the full coffee experience has always excited them.  

Last March they decided to finally take the plunge, quitting their jobs and emptying their 401Ks to open Broke Girl’s Coffee Bar in the urban community of Normal Heights. The combination of eclectic décor, a large outdoor patio with a performance stage and locally sourced coffee beans make Broke Girls a San Diego gem worth discovering. However, what makes this café truly special is its two owners with their contagious smiles and their deep care for the community.

Now almost a year into operations, the café has established itself as a community asset, with social and support groups meeting there regularly.  From leather-clad bikers to spoken word poets, those on the periphery have found a home within the art-covered walls and in the secluded back garden.  Operating on a shoestring budget and living an extremely modest lifestyle, Malakiah has kept her dream alive.  

She is now seeking some additional funding, in order to service her equipment, stock some of her popular items, and pay off some start-up debt which has now come current.  

The characteristics that are commonly seen in successful entrepreneurs can be found and felt upon walking into Malakiah’s café.  Ceaseless optimism, a no excuses mentality, and a deep passion for her work, make her a magnetic figure in the community, and one worth supporting.  By boosting her up, you can be confident that you are also providing a gathering place for those often left unserviced.  As members of the sober community, their space provides a sanctuary for those on the path to recovery, and to those among us just looking for a great cup of coffee and a warm smile.

loans.use: to service her equipment, stock some of her popular items, and pay off some start-up debt which has now come current

loans.name: Sumarni

texts.en:
Sumarni runs a small stall which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Sumarni lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Sumarni is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Sumarni began working with Ruma three years ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Mirian Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Aquí Hay Esperanza se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  2 años, ella está en su cuarto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Mirian es una gran esposa y ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a  su esposo el cual se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otra persona se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, salen en la madrugada y regresan en la tarde o hasta el otro día de acuerdo a como este la pesca, luego de recoger una buena cantidad de peces y camarones ellos  entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta la playa para luego llevarlas a otras ciudades, esta actividad la realiza su marido desde pequeño y es como  saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar materiales para pesca y combustible para la lancha. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Su sueño es tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The Aquí Hay Esperanza (Here There is Hope) credit group meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo area.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this lovely place.  Here the majority of people are very hardworking and do work related to the ocean.

Mirian lives in this place.  She is 24 years old and married.  From her marriage she has a two-year-old child.  She is four months pregnant with her second child.  Her husband works in fishing.

Doña Mirian is a great wife and homemaker who is taking out a loan to help her husband, who works in fishing.  Together with another person, he heads out to the high seas in his little boat to fish.  They leave at dawn and return in the afternoon or even the next day, depending on how the fishing is.  After catching a good quantity of fish and shrimp, they deliver them to merchants who come to the beach to later take the catch to other cities.  Her husband has done this work since he was very small, and it is how he is getting his family ahead.

This loan is to buy fishing supplies and fuel for his boat.  This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because in this way she can help her husband.  Her dream is to have her baby.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a driving school training car

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mercidita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell plastic wares business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from computer shop. Mercidita is borrowing 50000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional dura boxes and other plastic wares to sell for her business.

Mercidita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dura boxes and other plastic wares to sell for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: Es una joven amable y luchadora, tiene 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene a cargo el cuido de sus padres que ya son ancianos. Desde hace 10 años estableció una pulpería en su vivienda ubicada en la comunidad llamada Empalme de Columbus. Solicita su primer crédito para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio para poder tener disponible productos básicos que demandan los pobladores de su comunidad. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y en el fututo tener también una comidería y venta de refrescos naturales.
texts.en: Blanca is a kind young woman who is a fighter.  She is 26 years old and single, and she is in charge of caring for her parents, who are elderly.  Ten years ago she set up a convenience store in her home, located in the Empalme de Columbus neighborhood.  She is asking for her first loan to increase her business’s stock, in order to have available the basic products that the people in the community ask for.  Her dream is to make her business grow, and in the future to also have a food shop and sell natural beverages.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise in her business

loans.name: Wati

texts.en:
Wati runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Wati lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Wati is single and living with six people in the family home. 

Wati began working with Ruma 11 months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo es soltero pero tiene 1 hijo, vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus parientes Rodrigo es ayudante de panadería y quiere comprar material de construcción para hacer arreglos en su casa Rodrigo es la unica fuente de ingreso en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single, but he has one child.  He lives in El Alto in house made of brick and cement which belongs to his relatives.  Rodrigo is an assistant in a bakery, and he wants to buy construction materials to make repairs on his house.  

Rodrigo is the only source of income in his home and he needs help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make repairs on his house.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo es un joven soltero de 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
El es un joven emprendedor, comenta que se dedica a dos actividades una de ellas es la venta de útiles escolares y la otra la venta de maxan, ambas actividades lo realiza a pocos metros de su vivienda. A través de esta actividad obtiene un ingreso que le ayuda cubrir los gastos de su familia.
El ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de útiles ya que desea ampliar su negocio para ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así mejorar la economía de su familia.  
Timoteo sueña con ampliar su librería para poder incrementar su negocio, de esta manera podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Timoteo is a single young man.  He is 23 years old and lives together with his parents and siblings in the Suchitepequez region.

He is an enterprising young man. He says that he works two jobs.  One of them is selling school supplies, and the other is selling maxan [leaves used to wrap tamales].  He does both jobs just a few meters from his home.  Through this work he earns an income that helps him to cover his family’s expenses.

He has decided to ask for a loan of 4,000 quetzales to buy school supplies, because he wants to expand his business to offer his customers better service and, in this way, to improve his family’s finances.

Timoteo dreams of expanding his bookstore to be able to increase his business.  In this way he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to expand his business

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Saturnino es casado y tiene dos hijos, actualmente vive en la comunidad de Churuhata Belen en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Saturnino tiene dos ocupaciones es chofer de taxi y agricultor, necesita credito para comprar una vaca lechera para incrementar sus ventas de producción de leche. Saturnino es colaborado por su esposa en el ordeño y cuidado de su ganado
texts.en: Saturnino is married and has two children. He lives in the district of Churuhata Belen, in an adobe house that he owns. Saturnino has two jobs: he is a taxi driver and a farmer. He needs a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase his sales of milk. Saturnino’s wife helps him to milk the cows and take care of the cattle.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his production of milk.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su hermana en la comunidad de Churuhata Belen en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Miguel es agricultor  y necesita credito para comprar forraje para su ganado Miguel es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Miguel is single and has no children. He lives with his sister in the district of Churuhata Belen in an adobe house that he owns. Miguel is a farmer and he needs a loan to buy forage for his livestock. Miguel’s work is the only source of income in the house, so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy forage for his livestock.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en La Paz. Ella vive en una casa de acabado fino y paga alquileres. Tania continua dedicandose a la elaboración de joyas de plata, entre las condiciones duras de trabajo es que dicha elaboración le toma mucho tiempo y hasta altas horas de la noche. Tania necesita un credito para la compra de materia prima (plata) para su negocio de joyas Su esposo le ayuda pero debido a los gastos de la familia es que Tania necesita ayuda extra
texts.en: Tania is married and has two children.  She lives in La Paz, Bolivia.  She lives in a finished house and pays rent.  Tania continues working to make jewelry from silver.  Among the challenging conditions of her work is that this effort takes a lot of time and she stays up until late at night.  Tania needs a loan in order to buy raw materials (silver) for her jewelry business.  Her husband helps her but due to household family expenses Tania needs some extra assistance.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (silver) for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has had her business for three years and also earns an income from providing catering services. Marites has been sustaining her business activities with her own efforts and with the help of previous loans from NWTF.

Marites is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruits and vegetables to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has operated her business for the past six years and also earns additional income from rice farming. Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of previous loans from NWTF that she has successfully repaid. 

Amy is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods, and other products for her general store. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and married with two children. For the past 20 years, she has run an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Elizabeth is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wood, thread and other items for her weaving business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is single and she works hard to support her family. For the past four years, she has run a business drying fish in the Philippines.

Divina is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to dry. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Ivette Sayonara

texts.es: Es una joven jovial y comunicativa, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hermanos, el mayor de 31 años es independiente y la menor de 26 años trabaja en Panamá y le envía accesorios de plata para mujeres: Anillos, cadenas, aretes, pulseras, para que los venda en el Municipio de Puerto Cabezas a precios accesibles. Con el propósito de apoyar a su mamá solicita su primer financiamiento para diversificar los productos que ofrece en la pulpería que le estableció hace 2 años con fondos propios y con las ganancias percibidas le han permitido construirle un pequeño anexo de madera en un punto estratégico de la vivienda, con el objetivo de captar mayores clientes. Su sueño es que el negocio de su mama crezca, apoyarla y cuidar por ella, ya que tiene problemas de salud: Presión y Colesterol.
texts.en:
Ivette is a jovial and communicative young woman, a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 29 years old, single, and has 2 siblings, an older brother who is 31 and independent, plus a younger sister, 26 years old, who works in Panama and sends Ivette womens silver accessories: rings, chains, ear rings, and bracelets, to sell in the Municipality of Puerto Cabezas at accessible prices. 

With the intention of helping her mother, Ivette is requesting her 1st financing, in order to diversity the products offered in her mother's grocery store, established some 2 years ago with her own funds. With the earnings received, Ivette has constructed a small wooden annex in a strategic part of her house, with the objective of attracting more customers.

Ivette's dream is for her mother's business to grow, assisting with her care, since her mother has health problems: high blood pressure and high cholesterol.

loans.use: to diversify the products offered in her mother's grocery store.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio vive en concubinato y tiene 3 hijos. Julio vive en la comunidad de Chojasivi en una casa de ladrillo y cemento. Julio se dedica a la venta de leche, el negocio es familiar y el producto se vende a plantas industrializadoras Julio necesita crédito para comprar una vaca de raza mejorada para incrementar su producción de leche, Julio es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Julio lives with his partner and has 3 children. Julio lives in the district of Chojasivi in a house made of brick and concrete. Julio makes a living selling milk. He has a family business, selling the milk to factories.

Julio needs a loan to buy an improved breed cow to increase his production of milk. His work is the only source of income in the house, so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy an improved breed of cow.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia Zenovia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zenovia works selling food.  She makes different dishes like baked chicken, soups and sliced beef dishes. She works from 8am to 6pm and has been working in this field for 8 years.  Things are going well.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy products for cooking rice, vegetables and chicken.  

She is happy to be requesting this loan and promises to comply with all repayments.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia solicita Juana Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de accesorios como carros como parabrisas y aceites, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar parabrisas y aceite.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
