Juana Elizabeth continues to dedicate her business to selling automobile accessories such as windshields and oil. She has been in this business for 5 years now and it is doing well. Juana Elizabeth works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. Her dream is to expand her auto accessories business.

Juana Elizabeth is requesting the loan to purchase windshields and oil. She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy windshields and oil for her auto supply store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia vende desayunos,almuerzos y cenas, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Gloria continues to work in the restaurant business.  She sells breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She makes different kinds of dishes like baked chicken, soups and sliced beef dishes.  She works from 8am to 6pm.  She has been working in this field for 8 years and things are going well.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant building.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase products like rice, vegetables and chicken.  

She is happy about this loan and promises to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,la socia vende tortas,pasteles y cafes,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de cafetin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tortas y pasteles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Marcelina continues working in the café business. The member sells pastries, cakes and coffee. The member already has various years' experience in this business and it's going very well for her. The dream of the member is to grow the café business. The member is applying for the loan to buy pastries and cakes.

The member is happy because of the loan and she commits to fulfilling the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy pastries and cakes.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia solicita Lucila se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros como parabrisas,llantas y aceites, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar parabrisas y aceites.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Lucila continues working in the business of selling auto parts for cars like windshields, tires and oil. The member already has 5 years' experience in this business and it's going very well for her. The member works from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM. The dream of the member is to grow her business of selling accessories. The member is applying for the loan to buy windshields and oil.

loans.use: to buy windshields and oil.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues working selling groceries.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk and crackers.  She works from 8am until 10pm.  She has five years of experience in this business and things are going well.  Her dream is to grow her grocery business.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers.  

She is very happy about this loan and promises to comply with the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina is 56 years old and married with three children.She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

Vivina has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 9 years and also earns income by selling pre-paid mobile load. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Daniel K.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Daniel. He is married and has one child, age 8 years old, who is a school-going child. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to assist with the business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,507,000 leones (SLL) every month from his business. Change in the price of goods is the main problem he encounters in his business. He sometimes has huge losses if he does not use business tactics in order to recover his capital.

In 1999, Daniel established his food business selling beans and palm oil. When he was in primary school, he helped his parents trading in one place and another. He could not bear to see his parents struggling to pay his school fees and that of his siblings, so he decided to help in his own little way to provide for the family. He began his business after dropping out of school. Since then, he has been trading to make ends meet.

Daniel would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuff: beans, rice, groundnuts, etc. In the future, Daniel plans to strengthen his business, and the loan will help him buy more goods. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff: beans, rice, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Alcina

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Alcina to improve her business. She is single and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will use the loan to buy dolls for her kiosk. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Alcina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy dolls for her kiosk.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de juguetes y también vende artesania,la socia vende muñecas y carros y en el negocio de artesanía vende chompas y mantas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la artesanía y juguetes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar artesanía como chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina continues working in her business selling toys and also handicrafts.  She sells dolls and cars and in the craft business she sells sweaters and blankets.  She works from 8am to 6pm.  She has several years of experience in this business and things are going well.  Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell her crafts and toys.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy handicraft products like sweaters and knit objects.  

She is happy about this loan and promises to comply with the repayment.

loans.use: to buy handicraft products like sweaters and knit objects.

loans.name: Fredelina

texts.en: Fredelina is a diligent mother who is running a small retail store within the local community. She is 54 years old and has three children. She and her husband aspire to become financially stable in order to give their family a better life. With this regard, Fredelina aims to improve her retail store to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of grocery items, rice and feed to resell. She is hoping that with her loan request, she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items, rice and feed to resell.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Due to hardships of living, Emely needs to support her husband in earning income. She operates their motorcycle transport business while her husband cultivates their farmland. They aim to earn and save more income to cover their daily necessities and finance the schooling of their children. To continue using the motorcycle, Emely wants to avail a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy wheels, sprockets and gasoline and to renew her mayor's permit and license. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that they will be able to uplift their standard of living someday.

loans.use: to buy wheels, sprockets and gasoline and to renew her mayor's permit and license

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old and married with fourteen children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.  Evangeline has been raising livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Mariliza

texts.en:
Mariliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past 10 years and earns additional income from buying and selling fruit. Mariliza has successfully repaid her previous loan and has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with help from NWTF.

Mariliza is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional pig feed for her pig fattening business. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane. Ma. Victoria  has been sustaining her business activities through her past thirty loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Ma. Victoria  is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF.

Gemma is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fishing nets and other items for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other items

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.

Helen is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, and other products for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, and other products

loans.name: Awaskira Group

texts.es:
Alicia: Es una mujer amable, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada, no tiene hijos, es originaria de Rosita, sin embargo desde hace 12 años se trasladó al Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, por motivos familiares. Su esposo, trabaja de manera informal, como albañil. Desde hace 2 años alquila un tramo en el mercado, donde tiene una pequeña pulpería y venta de  bastimentos. Por alquiler del tramo paga mensualmente C$1,500 (mil quinientos córdobas). Su jornada laboral inicia desde las 6:30am – 9:00pm. Ella es la Coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Awaskira, nombre en lengua miskita que significa buena madera de pino. Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres muy trabajadoras que tienen deseos de superación. Este primer primer crédito lo está solicitando para comprar mercadería para su negocio: granos básicos, huevos, chiverías, gaseosas, pan, sopas instantáneas, salsas de tomate, jugos, papel higiénico y otros. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente en el tramo que alquila, tiene un pequeño espacio donde habita; también anhela llegar a tener una comideria (lugar donde se vende comida).

Francisca Arely: Es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, dos menores de edad y un adolescente que cursa su sexto grado de primaria. Desde hace 10 años, vende  frijoles cocidos, tortilla de maíz, tacos y enchiladas, en un tramo que alquila por C$2,500 (dos mil quinientos córdobas mensualmente) en el mercado en Bilwi. Ha dado empleo a una persona que le ayuda a elaborar tortillas y le paga un salaio mensual de C$2,200 córdobas. Solicita su primer crédito para comprar insumos que utiliza en su negocio: Aceite, carbón, frijoles, arroz, masa, carne, tomate y repollo. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir su vivienda, ya que en el tramo que alquila, tiene un pequeño espacio, que utiliza como vivienda.

Norma Yesenia: Tiene 3 hijos, dos menores de edad y un adolescente que cursa su segundo grado de primaria. Desde hace un año estableció su pulpería en un tramo que alquila en el mercado de Bilwi. Su compañero, tiene una carnicería donde vende  distintos tipos de carne. Solicita su primer crédito para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio: granos básicos, huevos, chiverías, gaseosas, pan, sopas instantáneas, jabón de lavar ropa, y otros. Su sueño es tener su vivienda, ya que actualmente viven  en el mismo tramo alquilado.
texts.en:
Alicia is a friendly woman. She is 43, married; she does not have children. She is native to Rosita, nevertheless 12 years ago she moved to the Municipality of Puerto Cabezas because of family. Her husband works informally as a mason. For the last 2 years, she has rented a space in the market, where she has a small food store and sells provisions. By renting the space, she pays C$1,500 monthly (one thousand five hundred córdobas). 

Her working day starts from 6:30am - 9:00pm. She is the coordinator of the Awaskira community bank, the name in Miskita language that means "good wood of pine." This community bank is made up of 3 very hardworking women who have the desire to get ahead. She is applying for this first loan to buy merchandise for her business: basic grains, eggs, snacks, soda, bread, instant soups, tomato sauces, juice, toilet paper and others. Her dream is to have her own home, since currently in the space she rents she has a small space where she lives. She also longs to have a restaurant (a place where food is sold).

Francisca Araly is a single mother. She has 3 children, two under age and an adolescent who is in sixth grade of primary school. For the last 10 years, she has sold cooked beans, corn tortillas, tacos and enchiladas in a space that she rents for C$2,500 (two thousand five hundred córdobas monthly) in the Bilwi market. She has given employment to a person who helps her make tortillas and she pays her a monthly salary of C$2,200 córdobas. She is applying for her first loan to buy supplies that she uses in her business: oil, charcoal, beans, rice, corn flour, meat, tomatoes and cabbage. Her dream is to buy land and build her home, since in the space she rents she has a small space that she uses as a home.

Norma Yesenia has 3 children, two under age and one adolescent who is in second grade of primary school. Since more than a year ago, she established her food store in a space that she rents in the Bilwi market. Her partner has a butcher shop where he sells different types of meat. She is applying for her first loan to increase the merchandise of her business: basic grains, eggs, snacks, sodas, bread, instant soups, laundry detergent, and others. Her dream is to have her home, since she currently lives in the same rented space.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Arturo Guadalupe

texts.es:
Arturo de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado,  está  casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen  dos hijos los dos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, el cliente es empleado trabaja desde hace seis años y su trabajo en tiempo libre es la agricultura.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar adobe, teja, madera y lamina para reparar su vivienda. Sueña poder dejarles a sus hijos una buena casa donde vivir, darles el estudio para que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Arturo is 35 years old and studied through the ninth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the household duties. They have two children who attend a school in the community. Arturo is employed and has been working at his job for six years. He engages in farming during his free time.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy adobe, tiles, wood, and corrugated sheets so that he can repair his home. His dream is to provide his children a decent house in which to live, as well as an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can repair his home.

loans.name: Los Intocables Group

texts.es:
Rio Verde. una comunidad vulnerable de la provincia de Esmeraldas. sus habitantes se dedican principalmente a la ganadería y la pesca. 
ANA. Vive en este lugar con sus 3 hijos y su esposo. Ella se dedica desde muy pequeña a la confección de prendas de vestir y uniformes escolares. Durante varios años ha trabajado con su vieja máquina de coser. Su aspiración más grande es tener su propio taller. Equipado con máquinas industriales. Contratar varias personas y también confeccionar uniformes deportivos  
ANA ha improvisado en la sala de su casa un pequeño espacio para su taller de costura. Ella aprendió este arte con su mamá quien conocía de su oficio.
El esposo de Ana no tiene trabajo estable y a menudo le ayuda en el taller. Sus hijos asisten normalmente a clases a pesar que la escuela queda un poco lejos de su comunidad.
Con el presente préstamo. Ella comprará una maquina industrial y telas para incrementar su trabajo. Tiene planeado dictar un taller de corte y confección a las chicas de la localidad donde vive. Desea apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta que sean profesionales.
Está segura de prosperar en su negocio y tener a futuro un taller más grande.

INFORMACION ADICIONAL
el grupo "Los Intocables" esta formado por 4 mujeres y 3 hombres. tienen actividades diferentes y en la fotografia se encuentra levantando la mano su lider.
texts.en:
Rio Verde is a vulnerable community in the province of Esmeraldas. Its inhabitants mainly work in livestock farming and fishing.

Ana lives here with her ​​three children and her husband. Since she was very young, she has worked making clothing and school uniforms. For several years she has worked with her ​​old sewing machine. Her greatest aspiration is to have her own workshop, equipped with industrial machines, hire several people and also make sports uniforms.

Ana has improvised a small space in her living room for her sewing workshop. She learned the skill from her mother who was a seamstress.

Ana's husband doesn't have a stable job and often helps in the workshop. Their children usually attend school, even though the school is quite a long way from their community.

With this loan, she'll buy an industrial machine and fabrics so that she can do more work. She plans to provide a tailoring service for the girls of the area where she lives. She wants to support her children in their studies until they are professionals.

She is sure that her business will thrive and that she will have a larger workshop in the future.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
The group "Los Intocables" consists of 4 women and 3 men engaged in different activities. In the photograph, their leader is raising her hand.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine, in order to one day have her own workshop

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia es soltera pero tiene 5 hijos, ella comparte su vivienda con uno de sus hijos y con una nieta Natalia vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento y paga un alquiler Natalia se dedica a la venta de ají, aceituna y tunta (una especie de tuberculo que se cultiva en Bolivia y sirve para los platos típicos), necesita un crédito para comprar estos ingredientes en mayor cantidad y así incrementar su venta de comestibles. Natalia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Natalia is single but has 5 children. She shares her home with one of her sons and a granddaughter. Natalia lives in La Paz, in a brick and cement house, and pays rent. Natalia sells chillies, olives and tunta (a kind of tuber that is grown in Bolivia and used in traditional dishes).

She need a loan to buy these ingredients in larger quantities and thus increase her sale of produce. Natalia is the only source of income in her household and so needs your help

loans.use: to buy chillies, olives and tunta (a Bolivian tuber used in traditional dishes)

loans.name: Perlitas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLITAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, trenzado de mantas, venta de polleras (ropa tradicional de la mujer boliviana), venta de semillas, confección de camas, venta de arena.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde niña ella apoyaba en el negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de los mercados tradicionales de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PERLITAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” communal bank has started their 5th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes Regional branch. It is composed of 8 members lead by a board of directors with Rosa as president. The businesses of the members are varied, amongst them are: the sale of vegetables, weaving blankets, selling polleras (the traditional skirt of the Bolivian woman), selling seeds, making beds and selling sand.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs amongst them Rosa. She says that she joined Pro Mujer when a promoter from the institution came and visited her in her house. She has a business selling vegetables. She learned this from her parents as since she was young she helped with the family business.

The loan that she is taking is to increase her working capital, buying vegetables wholesale. She will purchase them in the traditional markets of the city of El Alto and then sell them in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate the resources needed to support her family as she lives with her common-law husband and has 4 children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the savings and health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a repair/vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her repair/vulcanizing shop business.  Rebecca has been in this business for 7 years. Rebecca earns additional income from boarding house rental.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Jinnefer

texts.en:
Jinnefer is 32 years and is married with two children who are in school. For the past 10 years, she has been selling Avon, MSE, and Natasha products in the Philippines. Jinnefer is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jinnefer is requesting 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

Elsie is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She is requesting another NWTF loan to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June is 39 years old, married and has three children who are in school. June is in an agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

June has been in her business for 2 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, June would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lisset

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Lisset con su credikiva pues logró invertirlo en productos de primera necesidad que su clientela consume diariamente. Hoy sus inventarios aumentaron y así mismo impactó sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará  azucar, frutas, verduras, ranchos, víveres, refrescos, verduras, lácteos, y huevos, pues desea estar preparada para la semana santa, temporada en la cual  las compras de sus clientes aumentan pues comparten con familias y vecinos, dulces típicos y comidas preparadas en base a pescado, mariscos , frutas verduras etc. Ella está muy agradecida con los financiadores de Kiva y pide a ellos que la sigan apoyando, para continuar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Lisset with her CrediKiva. She has been able to invest it in staples that her customers consume daily. 

Today her inventory increased which impacts her sales. 

Currently she is applying for a new loan with which she will buy sugar, fruit, vegetables, chips, sodas, dairy products and eggs. 

She wants to start preparing for semana santa (Easter week), a season where her sales from clients increase since they share typical sweets and prepared foods made from fish, seafood, fruits, vegetables, etc. with their families and neighbors

She is very thankful to the Kiva financiers and ask that they keep supporting her so she can continue growing.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit, vegetables, chips, sodas, dairy products and eggs.

loans.name: Aviany

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Aviany  continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva bue tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende diferentes productos como leche, golosinas, arroz entre otros, la socia continua trabajando durante el día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, aceite entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Aviany is a member of the Communal Bank “Rosita de Los Angeles” which is located in the District of San Sebastián in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. She continues to manage her grocery business. Aviany has been in this line of work for a long time and it has brought her both financial and personal satisfaction. She sells different products such as milk, snack foods, rice, and other items. Aviany continues to work during the day. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sodas, oil, and other products. Aviany is grateful for the loan she has received and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy sodas, oil, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 43 years old, married, and blessed with four children. The two youngest are still at college level. Despite financial hardships, she and her husband planned to continue sending their children to school for they want to become professionals in the future. 

With this regard, Josefina aims to continue operating their motorcycle transport to generate additional income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve her source of income.

loans.use: to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Jenife

texts.en:
Jenife is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Jenife is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jenife requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in the pig fattening business for 2 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain it.

Jenife would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jonita

texts.en:
Jonita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like sugar, egg, milk, canned goods, etc for her general store business.  Jonita has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like sugar, egg, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madonna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Madonna earns more income from buying and selling bananas.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. Madonna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamnis, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Linda works hard to support her family. She has a rice-farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from nipa roofing making.  Linda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice-farming rice business.

Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: José Osmin

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad, esta acompañado, y tiene 4 hijos de 19, 23, 25 y 28 años de edad los cuales todos estan ya casados, de él depende solo su esposa. José estudio hasta primer grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivian sus padres, José y su compañera en la epoca de verano se dedican a la crianza de especies menores, y en la epoca de invierno se dedican a la agricultura; para llegar al trabajo José y su compañera de vida caminan una distancia de dos kilometros, trabajan en horario de 7:AM a 4:00 PM.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra. Para obtener una mejor cosecha y mejores ingresos.
José, sueña con aumentar su crianza de especies menores y tener una tienda para aumentar sus ingresos y asi  tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old, married and has four children, ages 19, 23, 25, and 28.  They are all married and he only supports his wife.  Jose has a first grade education.  He was not able to continue his education because of his parents’ poverty.  He and his wife raise small animals in the summertime and farm in the winter.  They travel 2km to get to work and work from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.

He is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as compost, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and pay for labor so that he can have a better harvest and improve his income.  Jose wants to increase his number of small animals and have a store so he can increase his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es:
Ella se llama Claudia milena  tiene 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Bogotá, cuando tenía 20 años  una amiga la vinculo a una empresa de confección  allí aprendió a darle terminado a las prendas, al comienzo le pareció muy interesante pues era algo nuevo para ella y así pasaron los años y fue adquiriendo experiencia en el campo de la confección. Actualmente tiene 3 hijos la mayor tiene 18 años le sigue el de 12 años y finalmente el de 22 meses, este último fue un regalo de DIOS pues no lo esperaba, cuando quedo embarazada del ultimo estaba trabajando en confección, terminando la licencia de maternidad decidió no continuar más, pues no consiguió quien le cuidara al bebe.
Un día el marido le comento una idea  que le pareció importante, comenzar a estudiar algo nuevo para ella donde  aprendiera  a superarse y así salir adelante con  la  familia, termino el bachillerato  con mucho esfuerzo y tomo la decisión  de seguirle la idea  a el marido, estudiar una carrera técnica. 
Se acercaron a  muchas instituciones les ofrecieron diferentes opciones pero todas demasiado costosas para el presupuesto, alguien les comento de CAMPO ALTO  y se acercaron a averiguar sobre el tema, le llamo la atención la carrera de AUXILIAR DE SERVICIOS FARMACÉUTICOS actualmente entra a segundo Semestre pero surge el  inconveniente, la preocupación que hay ahora es como poder seguir estudiando pues el semestre aumento demasiado y no tienen el dinero que estipularon en CAMPO ALTO.  
A Claudia le comentaron del convenio con KIVA, ya que ella está muy interesada por seguir estudiando, haciendo saber que sin el subsidio de kiva no podrá seguir con el proyecto de vida, espera con mucha ansiedad y fe tener el convenio de KIVA para poderse matricular y comenzar el segundo semestre con satisfacción y con la obligación de seguir adelante para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This is Claudia Milena. She is 36 years old and lives in the city of Bogotá. When Claudia was 20 years old, a friend connected her with a sewing business where she learned how to make clothes. At first, the work was very interesting since it was a new experience for her. As the years passed, she gained a great deal of sewing experience. Claudia currently has three children. Her oldest child is 18 years old and she also has a 12-year-old and a 22-month-old. The youngest child is a gift from God since her last pregnancy was unexpected. At the end of her maternity leave, Claudia decided not to return to her sewing job since she was unable to find anyone to take care of her baby.

One day her husband came up with an idea that seemed important at the time. He suggested that she study something new and learn a trade in which she could be successful and help their family get ahead. Claudia earned her high school diploma with great effort and then decided to follow through with her husband’s idea by studying for a technical degree.

She looked at several institutions that offered various options, but they were all too expensive for her budget. Someone suggested that she look at CampoAlto and she was drawn to the Pharmacy Services Technician program. Claudia is currently in her second semester, but now she must deal with the challenge of not being able to continue her studies. The cost for this semester has increased and she does not have the funds that CampoAlto requires.

Claudia says that she is participating in the Kiva program because she is very interested in continuing her studies. Without the help of the Kiva loan, she would not able to continue toward this goal for her life. She waits anxiously and faithfully for the approval of her Kiva loan so that she can enroll and begin her second semester successfully. Claudia feels obligated to press forward so that she can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Abejitas De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ABEJITAS DE COLLPANI” iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mauricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de fundas, venta de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de utensilios, venta de venestas, venta de flores, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mauricia es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió del negocio de su madre, donde ella apoyaba, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato  y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito, los ahorro y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ABEJITAS DE COLLPANI” communal bank has started their 26th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office. It has 8 members and is lead by a board of directors with Mauricia as president. The businesses of the members are varied, amongst them are: sewing bed-clothing, selling sweaters, a neighborhood store, selling utensils, selling wood products, selling flowers and sewing back packs

The loan will benefit all of these micro-entrepreneurs including Mauricia. She joined Pro Mujer 7 years ago on the invitation of a member of the institution who visited her in her house. She has a business selling spices. She says that she learned about this business from her mother who she used to help. Later she decided to start her own business in her area.

The loan will be used to increase her working capital buying spices wholesale from the distribution centers in the city of El Alto. Then she will sell them in her commercial space. Working in this way allows her to generate income to help her family. She lives in a common-law relationship and has 6 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training about loans and health and the health and saving services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy spices wholesale.

loans.name: Pheap Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 42 years old. He is a married man who has two children. He lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He and his wife are farmers. 

Pheap is a leader of this borrower group. He will use his portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help his family live in good conditions. 

In the future, he hopes that he can breed animals to resell their offspring for profit.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Jorge Mauricio

texts.es: Jorge tiene 19 años de edad y habita junto a su padre en casa familiar. Jorge es un joven emprendedor quien desde hace 5 años se gana la vida mediante la comercialización de variedad de prendas de vestir y carteras. La venta  la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como se gana la vida y apoya con la economía  del hogar. Su negocio es muy importante puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir y carteras. De esta forma espera sacar adelante a su familia Y dar mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jorge is 19 years old and lives with his father in the family home.  Jorge is a young entrepreneur who has been earning a living selling a variety of clothing and wallets for the past five years.  He sells on foot and earns a living and supports the household this way.  His business is very important because he doesn’t have another source of income, so he is asking for this loan through FUSAI, to buy a variety of clothing and wallets so he can support this family and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and wallets.

loans.name: Mlimani Group Msm

texts.en:
Majira, who is in his mid 30's, is married with five daughters who are still going to school. He has been a carpenter for eight years now.  He works from 7 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Majira's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy wood and managed to make more furniture and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is happy with the the loan.  He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a small house, and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy equipment for the carpentry business to meet his customers' demand.  He dreams of owning a wholesale shop. 

Majira will share this loan with his loan group, Mlimani,  which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment for the carpentry business to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Sakata Grp Group

texts.en:
Wegina is from Tujijenge Tanzania, and this is his first loan request.  He is in his early thirties, is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. He makes his family living by running a motorbike service. Wegina operates his business from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Wegina will use this loan to buy a new motorbike. He dreams of building a nice family house. Wegina will share this loan with his loan group" SAKATA " which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Ada Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Ada Maritza de 36  años de edad es soltera,  tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, valle al sur de honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05  años  a la venta de ropa nueva, también vende calzado, sandalias y lociones,  su venta es ambulante en los barrios y colonias de san Lorenzo, sus clientes le prefieren por sus buenos precios y variedad en sus productos, ella viaja en buses y en taxi a los lugares largos para poder vender sus productos.
Doña Ada es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir delante. Está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa nueva de playa alusiva para esta época de semana santa, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA es una buena cliente que solicita su quinto préstamo.
Doña Ada su sueño es tener un buen negocio y mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Ada Maritza is 36 years old, single, and has two children who depend on her for support.  She lives in San Lorenzo, located in the southern Honduras valley.  She has a home of her own and has been selling new clothing, shoes, sandals, and lotions on foot for the past five years through the San Lorenzo neighborhoods.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because of her good prices and the quality of her merchandise.  She travels by bus and taxi to the places where she will sell her items.

Ada is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan to buy new beach apparel for the Holy Week season.  This loan will help her to increase her income and she is very happy to be working with PRISMA.  She is a good client and is asking for her fifth loan.

Ada’s dream is to have a good business and improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2014

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Agustina Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Agustina continua con su negocio de venta de desayunos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas  como personales, la socia vende quinua, kiwicha, entre otros, la socia continua vendiendo en uno de los paraderos urbanos de la ciudad, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de quinua, azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the communal bank “Rosita de los Ángeles”. The bank is located in the district of San Sebastian, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Agustina is continuing her business of selling breakfast meals. She has been doing this for some time, and it has brought her great satisfaction, both financial and personal. She sells quinoa and kiwicha, among other products. She is continues to sell her products at one of the urban posts in the city.
This member wants to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy quinoa, sugar, milk and other products.

Agustina is grateful for the loan granted to her and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, sugar and milk, among other products.

loans.name: Jessilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Jessilda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming bananas. Jessilda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Jessilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising poultry in the Philippines. Josie requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

Josie has been raising poultry for two years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.  Lilia has been raising cattle for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing. Emelita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc. for her food vending business.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marcy

texts.en:
Marcy is 43 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, sanitary napkins, coffee, etc., to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Marcy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, sanitary napkins, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 56 years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. Ema aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.  She sells seafood  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Catarina to improve her business. She is married and has five children. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca-Cola, oils, slippers and cards. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. Her husband is driver.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca-Cola, oils, slippers and cards.

loans.name: Damni Group

texts.es:
Karen Elizabeth: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, es una joven amable y emprendedora, casada con 3 hijos: Dos en edad escolar y un menor de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, ofrece los servicios de chapoda. Con el objetivo de incrementar su nivel de ingresos han conformado el grupo solidario Damni, que en miskito significa dulce, el grupo está integrado por 3 mujeres que se dedican a la venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada de camisetas y shorts y venderlas a precios accesibles en las comunidades y en el corredor de su casita de tambo de madera. Su sueño es que su negocio prospere y elaborar pan.

Ana Elizabeth: Está casada y tiene 4 hijos: 2 mujeres y 2 varones, la mayor es independiente y 3 adolescentes que cursan su primaria y un menor de edad de 11 meses.  Desde hace 3 meses inició su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, en el corredor de su casita de tambo de madera. No obstante, desde hace 2 años vende nacatamal de pollo y cerdo de viernes a domingo. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada de faldas y blusas y venderlas a precios accesibles en la ciudad de Bilwi. Su sueño es tener una comideria.

Claudia: Es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 3 meses vende ropa usada y nacatamal de pollo y cerdo de viernes a domingo. Solicita su primer financiamiento para para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada de toallas, sabanas, cortinas y funda. Su sueño es que su pequeño negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Karen Elizabeth: Originally from Puerto Cabezas, she is a friendly and enterprising young woman who is married with 3 children. Two are school-aged and one is younger. Her husband works on the informal labor market, offering tree trimming services. With the aim of increasing her income level, she joined the communal bank "Damni," which means "sweet" in the Miskito language. The group is made up of three women who dedicate themselves to selling used clothing as mobile vendors. She is requesting her first loan in order to buy a bundle of used clothing, made up of t-shirts and shorts, in Managua, so she can sell them at affordable prices in the local communities and from the courtyard of her wooden house. Her dream is that her business will prosper and expand into making bread.

Ana Elizabeth: She is married and has 4 children, 2 girls and 2 boys. The oldest is independent; the 3 adolescents are in primary school, and one child is 11 months old. Three months ago, Ana Elizabeth started her small business selling used clothing from the courtyard of her wooden house. In addition, she has been selling chicken and pork nacatamales [traditional Nicaraguan tamales] for two years, from Fridays through Sundays. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bundle of used clothing in Managua, made up of skirts and blouses, to sell at affordable prices in the city of Bilwi. Her dream is to run a restaurant. 

Claudia: She is a single mother with two grown children. For the past three months, she has sold used clothing and chicken and pork nacatamales from Fridays through Sundays. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bundle of used towels, sheets, curtains and pillowcases in Managua. Her dream is to see her little business prosper.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Despite being a widow, Remedios has the determination to uplift their status of living to give her family a better life. She is 51 years old and blessed with three children. 

She is running a small retail store within the  her community to generate additional income. She aims to strengthen this business to have a higher income but due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy more stocks of canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, frozen foods and vegetables to resell. She is hoping that she will receive her loan in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, frozen foods and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn, a 49-year-old married mother of two, has been raising livestock in the Philippines for 10 years, and also earns income from farming sugarcane. She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Marelyn  is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Anecita works hard to support her family. She has a coconut-farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal-vending. Anecita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies for her coconut-farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business. Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 38 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elsa has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Félix Alfredo

texts.es:
Félix de 22 años de edad,  estudio hasta el bachillerato, está soltero, vive con sus padres. Es un joven emprendedor que sabe lo que quiere, piensa en su futuro y su estabilidad, a pesar de su edad ya toma compromisos serios.   

Se dedica a trabajar la tierra, desde los cinco años su padre lo indujo al buen camino, de ser una persona de bien y productiva. En la zona que vive es totalmente agrícola, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, también tiene ganado los cuales cuida, él trabaja en las tierras de su padre, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de la casa por lo que no necesita un medio de transporte para ir a su trabajo, la actividad la realiza en compañía de su papá,  el horario de trabajo lo realiza de 5 am a 12 md.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la reparación del techo de su casa, ya cuenta con una parte de la madera para iniciar, lo que comprara es (teja, clavos, regla, etc.), el mejoramiento en la calidad de vida será el tener un lugar más digno que cuando llueva no tendrá que preocuparse porque se vaya a mojar.
 
Sus sueños a futuro son irse haciendo de sus propias cosas a medida se vaya esforzando y  trabaje, el préstamo le ayudara a realizar esa mejora en la vivienda.
texts.en:
Félix is 22 years old. He finish his Secondary school studies, is single and lives with his parents. He is a young entrepreneur who knows what he wants and thinks about the future and his stability. In spite of his age he has already taken on some serious compromises.

Félix works the land. Five years ago his father started him in this field, in order to be a good and productive person. The area where he lives is totally devoted to agriculture. He grows corn and sorghum and he also has cattle he cares for. The land he works belongs to his parents and is located close to his house so he doesn't have to take transportation to get there. He works with his father and works from 5 am until noon.

The loan that Félix is requesting is to repair the roof of his house and he already has some wood to start. What he will buy is nails, tiles and a measuring instrument, etc. This will improve his quality of living as he will have a more dignified house. When it rains he won't have to worry about things getting wet. His plan is to continue to do his own thing with effort and work. The loan will help him improve his house.

loans.use: to buy tiles, nails, a measuring instrument, etc. to repair his roof

loans.name: Mercedes Del Transito

texts.es:
Mercedes de 30 años de edad, esta acompañada, y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad, los cuales dependen de ella, su compañero de vida trabaja como empleado, Mercedes estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, y no siguio estudiando porque decidio acompañarse. Mercedes durante el verano se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, y en el invierno se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años, trabajo que lo aprendio de sus padres, para llegar a su trabajo tiene que caminar un kilometro, trabaja en el horario de 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra para cultivar. Así obtendrá una mejor cosecha y mejores ingresos. 

Mercedes, sueña con mejorar su negocio, darles estudios a sus hijos y construir una mejor vivienda y asi vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages 3 and 1 who depend on her for support.  Her life’s partner is an employee.  Mercedes has a high school education and didn’t continue studying because she decided to get married.  Mercedes sells fruits and vegetables in the summertime and farms in the winter.  She has been doing this for seven years and learned this from her parents.  She must walk 1km to get to work and works from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.

She is asking for this loan through CREDICAMPO so she can buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and pay for labor.  This way she can have a better harvest and improve her income.

Mercedes dreams of having a better business, providing her children with an education, improving her home, and living better.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ingrid Consuelo

texts.es:
Ingrid de 25 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado, esta soltera vive con su madre y una cuñada. Las que se apoyan unas a las otras en todo, es una mujer luchadora.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a la actividad, su madre fue quien le enseño que si aprendía a defenderse con su trabajo donde quiera que fuese no quedaría mal, también se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen ganado, gallinas, cerdos, los que cuidan para cuando tienen deseo de comer huevos o gallina en sopa, o por alguna necesidad que tengan de vender. El trabajo lo hace en el campo le queda a unos 500 metro de retirado de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, ya que es de la única formo de caminar por caminos alternos, el horario de trabajo es de 5 am a 12 md. 


El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la tierra y posteriormente la compra de los insumos agrícolas entre ellos abono, herbicida, pago de trabajadores.  La necesidad satisfecha será el tener  su propio capital de trabajo y no tener que andar buscando prestado a particulares.

Planea en el futuro poderse casar y formar su familia,  con respecto al trabajo piensa seguir luchando mientras su estado físico se lo permita, cuando recolecte la cosecha venderá y otra parte será para el consumo, de la venta de los cultivos pagara la cuota del préstamo y lo demás lo invertirá en su casa.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 25 years old. She went to school up to second grade. She is single and lives with her mother and a sister-in-law. All of them support each other in everything. Ingrid is a very determined woman. 

She works in agriculture, and she has done this work for more than 15 years. Her mother was the one who taught her that if she learned to support herself with her own work, she would not be in a bad situation no matter where she was. She also takes care of domestic chores. The family has cows, chickens and pigs, which they raise for the times when they would like to eat eggs or chicken soup, or in order to sell the animals when they need to for some reason. She works on a plot of land about half a kilometer from her house, and she walks there on a footpath. She works from 5 a.m. until noon. 

The loan will be invested in preparing the soil and later in buying agricultural supplies including fertilizer and herbicides. She will also pay workers. The need it will satisfy is that she will have her own working capital and not need to go around looking for loans from private individuals. 

In the future, she plans to get married and start a family. With respect to her work, she plans to continue working hard as long as her physical condition permits. When she harvests her crops, she will sell a portion and the rest will be for consumption. From the sale of her crops she will pay off the loan, and she will invest the rest in her house.

loans.use: to prepare the soil, to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is still single with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling lesos (women's wraps). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase pieces of lesos (women's wraps) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of lesos (women's wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Ella es Josefa, tiene 55 años de edad y es casada. Su esposo y ella viven en casa propia fruto y esfuerzo de su trabajo a lo largo de los años.  Aprovechando la ubicación de su casa que se encuentra en una avenida principal, decidieron poner un negocio de tlapalería desde hace 4 años. Con el crédito solicitado compraran mercancía  para su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.  Ser responsable  y fuerte es una de las características de Josefa que le ha permitido tener un ingreso propio  sin depender de nadie,  su logro vivir cómodamente y feliz con su esposo, su reto reforzar su  negocio  de manera que sea sustento de su familia hasta la vejez.
texts.en: This is Josefa.  She is 55 years old and married.  Her husband and she live in a home of their own, which is a product of their efforts over the years.  Their home is located on a main street and they decided to start a hardware business four years ago so they could take advantage of the location.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise for her business and increase sales.  Being strong has allowed Josefa to have an income of her own without having to depend on anyone.  This has allowed her to live comfortably and happily with her husband.  Her challenge is to strengthen her business so that it will provide for her family into their old age.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is 38 years old and the mother of seven children. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and two cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 41-year-old vigorous married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifthth loan cycle  and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita, a married mother, works as a seamstress from Monday to Sunday in order to generate income for her family. Her husband works in construction, but his salary is too low for him to be able to provide for the family alone. 

Drita makes women's clothing for a variety of tastes. She differs from other seamstresses because she works very fast and has developed a good reputation for the quality of her work. She is usually able to complete orders so quickly that her customers hardly feel they have had to wait. She loves her work very much and keeps very busy. 

Drita is now requesting a loan to purchase more materials for her work. The loan will help her to expand her business and thereby increase her income.  Knowing that it is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her work

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a married lady with seven children, hailing from Ruti, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. Unfortunately, the husband is earning little and doesn’t mind about the family’s welfare or even the children’s tuition. 

She operates a business of piggery and it’s where she earns a living and survival for the whole family. She even managed to save some money and constructed a house and she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 to build a better structure for the pigs and also to buy better quality piglets which will enhance her sales and profits. She is hard-working and resilient. Her determination is to see her children all through school.

loans.use: To buy building materials for construction of a pig sty

loans.name: Casa Grande Group

texts.es: El grupo lo coordina el señor José de 56 años de edad acompañado y padre de dos hijos de lo cual solamente uno depende de él, es propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio y cuenta con la ayudad de su compañera en la venta y compra de sus productos que ofrece, el socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en su negocio como granos básicos, arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa maggi, marucham, galletas, refrescos, pan, tortas, etc. Otra de las socias es Auxiliadora de 38 años de edad  propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y la señora Erika de 34 años de edad, la cual vende sandalias en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The group coordinator is Sr. José. He is 56 years old, in a relationship, and the father of two children. One child is still dependent on him. José is the owner of a grocery store in his home. He has the help of his companion with buying and selling the products that he offers. José is requesting a loan in order to invest in his business. He will buy basic grains, rice, beans, oil, soup mix, instant noodles, cookies, soft drinks, bread, cakes, and other items.

The other members are as follows:
• Auxiliadora is 38 years old and the owner of a grocery store in her home.
• Sra. Erika is 34 years old and sells sandals in her community.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, beans, oil, soup mix, instant noodles, cookies, soft drinks, bread, cakes, and other items.

loans.name: Titalyn

texts.en:
Titalyn is 43 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Titalyn has been farming rice for eleven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Titalyn would like to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wendy Yuledys

texts.es: Hace 4 años Wendy, inició su negocio desde el año 2010, cuando su hermana le entusiasmó para se dedicara a la actividad coemrcial, con el fin de generar mas ingresos y desde ese momento su dinámica comercial no se detiene. Ella vende de contado y a crédito directamente a sus clientes  todos los dias, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Sus principales cleintes son sus vecinos, amigos y referídos, que dia a dia hacen que su cartera de clientes crezca. Su meta mas adelante, es abrir un local al público, porque aumentar sus ventas y fidelizar su clientela es su mayor desafio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer fianciamiento que hace la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans camisas, blusas y pantalones en un mayor volumen, todo con el fin de compñacer a sus clientes respondiendo a sus pedidos y con el objetivo de ganar un poco mas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
4 years ago, since the year 2010, Wendy began her business, when her sister got her excited to dedicate herself to commercial activity with the aim of generating mas income and from that moment her trade dynamics do not hold her back. She sells in cash and credit directly to her customers every day, from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. Her main customers are her neighbors, friends and references, which day to day make her reputation for customers grow. Her goal ahead is to open a locale to the public, because to augment her sales and gain her customers loyalty is her biggest challenge. 

This is the reason for which she is requesting a credikiva, her first funding that she is making to the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase jeans, shirts, blouses and trousers in a greater volume, all with the aim of pleasing her customers, responding to their orders and with the objective of earning a little more, making the credikiva a successful investment.

loans.use: purchase jeans, shirts, blouses and trousers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Haxhere

texts.en:
Haxhere wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped her to purchase a milk cow, allowing her to reduce her costs and expenses for milk and milk products. She and her husband work very hard and love their family very much so they have been pleased to have opportunities from the lenders. 

She was very satisfied with the loan process and the results that she has enjoyed from her cow and would like to again request a loan for another cow, but for this time to sell the milk and products in her neighborhood. This loan will help her to generate more income for her family and therefore improve their living standards and conditions. She hopes in the future to continue to expand her farm and number of cows so that she can then give her children a better education. She is very thankful for both of the loans.

loans.use: To buy another milk cow to sell the milk and products in her neighborhood

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of profit. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 22-year-old married woman. She is running a business selling milk with her husband for the past five years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Rehana has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Rehana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien la socia sigue en su negocio de restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.
